jobs.title: Director of B2B Marketing
jobs.description:
Director of B2B Marketing @ The Wanderlust Group

Location: Remote Friendly. Headquarters in New England. 

Hi! We're The Wanderlust Group an outdoor technology company comprised of Dockwa, Marinas.com and Campouts.com. Put simply, we believe the world would be a better place if people were able to spend more time outdoors connected to nature and each other. We build technology to make those experiences more accessible, affordable and enjoyable for all backgrounds.

At The Wanderlust Group, you'll be an integral part of a small team, able to make an immediate impact and work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people anywhere. We believe that a great culture enables great teams to do incredible things.

The Position

We are searching for someone to lead our B2B marketing team and its marketing strategy targeting marinas and campgrounds. This is a high-impact role built for someone who likes having their hands in the full end-to-end strategy for an audience. In this role you'll run the acquisition, sales enablement and customer marketing strategies for our audience of Marinas - expanding into campgrounds over the coming years. You'll manage a team of 3-4 to start, and oversee the career development of each member. 

In this role you and your team will:

  • Run targeted B2B campaigns for strategic accounts
  • Deepen our inbound marketing funnel, using SEO and new content to attract leads.
  • Use data to optimize conversion paths and drive free tier users and demo requests.
  • Oversee our B2B events and partnerships strategies. 
  • Support our sales team with collateral and narratives where needed.
  • Launch new features to our marina customers and leads.
  • Use data to develop and deploy upgrade strategies at the right time for our customers.

We think the best candidates will have a mix of the following skills and traits.  However, do not be ruled by the bullet points - if you are lacking on experience in one of these areas but still feel like a strong fit for the role, don't hesitate to apply:

  •  You have a desire to run end-to-end strategies.  We have a ton of respect for specialists, but this role needs someone who is versatile and can see the big picture.
  •  You have experience driving demand.  Whether it was for a product launch or a monthly MQL goal, we need someone who has a track record of bringing in leads.  Experience with account-based marketing or targeted campaigns as well as inbound demand gen is ideal.
  • You are a thoughtful manager.  You have experience managing or leading teams and have examples of how you've helped those who you work with grow and progress in their careers. 
  • You have experience with small business owners. Many of the marinas we work with are family run businesses. Whether you've marketed to them before or you know small business owners yourself, it helps to have an appreciation for what they need and go through.
  •  You admire your peers in sales and customer success.  This role only works if you've got an appreciation for the work those teams do and the challenges they face.
  • You have experience using HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, Intercom.  These are the tools you'll use most heavily in this role so prior experience would be ideal.
  • You are comfortable setting goals, interpreting data, and reporting on your impact.

Working at Wanderlust
The Wanderlust Group is a unique company.  A hybrid B2B and B2C business, we connect boaters to marinas and campers to campgrounds.  Because we believe in the value of putting screens down and  getting outside, the entire company practices offline Mondays.  Spend your Mondays hiking, thinking, reading, sailing. It doesn't matter as long as you're not emailing or in meetings. We also care a lot about the marinas and campgrounds we serve.  They are often small businesses playing an important role in the local economy around them.  That dedication carries through our work. Finally, because we are wanderers at heart, this position is open to remote candidates.

jobs.title: Content Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Who we are

At Personify, we build strong connections with our clients so they can build strong connections with their communities. One of the most diversified and fastest-growing technology providers of integrated software solutions, we are innovative leaders in the industry and respond to the needs of our clients through products that include:

  • A2Z Events, a multi-event platform that enables clients to manage their events from start to finish, including floor plans, financials, managing contracts and sponsorships, and increasing engagement through mobile applications and a networking suite.
  • CommUnity, an online community platform for those with common interests to connect, learn and collaborate.
  • Wild Apricot, an all-in-one solution that automates and simplifies workflows enabling nonprofits and associations to manage their membership, streamline their processes, and make room for human connections.
  • Member Clicks, an easy-to-use member management cloud solution aimed at small to medium-sized nonprofit organizations and associations.
  • ThreeSixty, an enterprise management solution for associations, nonprofits, YMCAs and JCCs to engage, manage and grow their membership.
  • And more.

At Personify, we're in the relationship building business, powering conversations, donations, events, and foundations through analytics, tools, and robust backend management systems. With 300+ employees in our offices in Austin, Atlanta, and Toronto, and as part of remote teams across Canada and the US, we're the people designing the technology that reaches 30,000+ clients resulting in 3B+ interactions a year with our products. Joining us is a chance to take your skills and expertise and build solutions for the real world that strengthen the connection between clients, their mission and their communities.

 

Who we need

We're looking for a Content Marketing Manager to join our SaaS inbound marketing team and grow our content acquisition machine. Under our Senior Content Marketing Manager, you will own the content for MemberClicks as a part of our Small-Medium Business (SMB) unit.

SEO is a crucial driver for our segment, and you're going to be instrumental in making MemberClicks an industry-leading brand publisher in our space. You will work across the marketing funnel, write to the needs of our audience (Nonprofits, trade associations, Chambers of Commerce, etc.), and have a direct impact on business results. You will blend your fine-tuned analytical skills with your creative mind by developing content that appeals to Google's algorithm, supports the buying journey, and helps our audience increase the impact of their mission-driven organizations.

Who you are

You're a wordsmith by trade and are always looking for ways to improve your writing, editorial, and proofreading (hey, grammar nerds!) skills. But you go beyond being a Creative: you bring an understanding of B2B strategy, full-funnel marketing, and content optimization. You care about how your content impacts business results and are motivated to take ownership of reporting on what is or isn't working.

If you've been involved in the nonprofit sector as a volunteer, staff member, marketer, board member, or otherwise, make sure you highlight this experience: already understanding our audience could give you a leg up in the application process!

What's in it for you

  • Influence and balance. MemberClicks is a recent acquisition, with an exciting opportunity to be a part of a transformative SEO project. You will own a massive library of content to build a strategy. You will be the owner and the driver of the voice and messaging, reaching an audience of small-to-mid-sized associations, chambers and nonprofits seeking solutions. This is a chance to use content to create real business results.
  • In-demand skills growth. You'll get to partner with a technical SEO Consultant, immediately growing your understanding of how to optimize content. You will learn what parts of a website or web page do and don't affect SEO (diving into page speed, mobile responsiveness, data structure, etc.) as well as SEO for video content. 
  • An impactful multifaceted role. You will be part of a robust content programme, contributing as a content strategist, writer, editor, and project manager. You'll have access to a team of freelancers and a content agency to make your magic happen, and you'll have access to the data you need to see the tangible results of your work.
  • Career development. You will report to a manager who prides themselves on supporting their team's career progression and skills development. They will guide and coach you towards increased independence and autonomy in your role. You will build the expertise and exposure to move up to a Senior Marketing Manager, Content Strategist, or SEO Consultant here or elsewhere. Or move into another vertical at Personify, further broadening your skills.
  • Collaboration, both casual and corporate. At Personify, we offer a balance between established and responsive, between new and tenured. We are proud to say many of our team members have been here for 5, 10, even 15 years, alongside the teammates who've joined us recently. While this is a fully remote role, the option to join us in our casual, energetic Toronto office is open (when you feel comfortable doing so). You will be part of an incredible Content Marketing team working together to create content that really matters to our audience.

How you will make an impact:

  • Grow your knowledge. You will dive into learning about our customers: nonprofits, associations, clubs, and membership organizations. You will explore their web-based groups, newsletters, etc., understand how to position our solutions and comprehend how they are already - or could be - engaging us. You will develop and launch a quarterly webinar series featuring key industry leaders in the association space.
  • Produce whip-smart content. You will outline, assign, edit, and publish blog content that drives traffic to our site and provides real value to our audience. You will plan and write high-value gated content (ebooks, guides, checklists, etc.), resulting in a high conversion rate. To help you get great work done on time, you will oversee and guide 2-4 freelancers and work with our content agency to create strategic guest posts that build our backlink profile.
  • Collaborate to drive results. You will work with our Senior Content Marketing Manager and our SEO Consultant to create content within a portfolio SEO strategy that promotes MemberClicks to our target prospects—without cannibalizing the target markets of Personify's other brands. You will gain and apply new insights and approaches to optimizing content.
  • Apply full-funnel thinking to the content you create. You will build out your understanding of how thought leadership and nurture content come together to position our solutions as the answer to target markets' pain points. You will continuously seek out best practices for lead generation through content marketing.

What you bring:

  • The education and experience. You have 2+ years of experience in a B2B Content Marketing or SEO role, preferably for a SaaS company or agency. Exposure to the SMB segment is a plus. A portfolio demonstrating your ability to capture attention and drive engagement is essential.
  • The creativity and the analytics. You have substantial experience writing, editing, proofreading, and publishing content and an understanding of organic SEO, inbound marketing, full-funnel marketing, and content journeys. You've created valuable gated assets (ebooks, guides, checklists, etc.) that result in high landing page conversion rates and capture high-quality prospects for nurture. 
  • The technical skills. You know how to rank on Google for a chosen keyword and have results you can share with us. You may have some experience with HubSpot or other marketing automation platforms. 
  • The philosophy. You're self-driven with a desire to experiment, fail, learn, and grow. You're a team player who knows collaboration is the key to any organization's success.
  • The communication and interpersonal skills. Your writing is exceptional, and you have equally strong oral and presentation skills. You can easily build a positive, professional relationship with stakeholders at any level, comfortably working across teams.

Why join us?

We are committed to creating a balanced, inclusive, and equitable workplace.

  • We recognize and appreciate the varied experiences, backgrounds, and knowledge our team can bring to our culture, operations, products, and relationships internally and externally.
  • We have an impactful recruitment diversity strategy to increase representation across the company at every level. And, we're working with our teams to create employee resource groups that further support our people in the safe spaces and ways they need to feel heard.

We're proud of our evolution. We promote -and live- a culture of not just listening but acting, making ourselves available and accessible.

We're a great place to work.

Guided by our values, inspired by our clients, and forging ahead with optimism and the commitment to service of a new President and CEO, Scott Collison, at the helm, Personify is driven by our purpose. We empower our clients, from small nonprofits to large enterprise organizations, to build strong connections with their communities, ultimately enabling them to achieve their missions. And, our leadership team brings profound expertise and a deep commitment to taking Personify to the next level.

With generous paid-time-off, flexibility, and the option to be fully remote, we prioritize the well being of our teams. Choosing where to power up their laptops empowers our employees to connect with each other and our clients from anywhere while meeting their life demands and without sacrificing their performance. In fact, we know it makes them do better, feel better, and enjoy being part of our company.

Recognized by Built In Austin in its Best Places to Work Awards in both 2019 and 2020, we spend our days creating a virtual place and physical space where people are comfortable being themselves, feel supported and heard, enjoy each other's company, and have an opportunity to shine.

Apply now.

Personify is a company made up of people who like to work with brilliant teams passionate about delivering exceptional solutions to our clients. We're a place to make an impact, see the difference, and accelerate your career doing something you love.

We know not everyone gains their education and skills the traditional way, so if you feel you have 70% of the qualifications you are looking for and you are ready to make a difference, submit your application. Of course, we can't promise it will be a fit, but we do promise to consider the full scope of who you are and what you bring.

Personify is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, veteran or disability status, or other protected characteristics.

Employment offers are contingent on the candidate successfully completing a background investigation in compliance with federal, provincial and local laws.

jobs.title: CRM Associate
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Hungryroot is your personal grocer, powered by AI and the belief that food deeply impacts your daily life. You tell us a little about yourself, and we use proprietary predictive technology to deliver groceries and recipes that best suit your individual needs and goals. We also assist with meal planning and nutritional support, helping you save time, save money, shop sustainably, and eat what makes you feel your best.

We are a distributed team built on top talent from over 10 states across the U.S. While we have an office in NYC, we support employees creating “offices” wherever they are. We believe in fostering team connection and collaboration across all of our “offices” - so don't expect to be online at 6 am to make a meeting if you're on the West coast. Expect to attend regular team building events, and to be able to work from the beach every once in a while. Expect to be treated like an owner who cares about our common goal, not someone who has to clock in and out of work.

Hungryroot is more than doubling in revenue year-over-year, profitable, and rapidly growing - this is why we need you!

What You'll Do

We're looking for a CRM Associate to join our growing performance marketing team. In this role, you will be responsible for the creation and deployment of email campaigns, as well as the reporting and performance monitoring of those campaigns. Using your analytical skills and customer-focused mindset, you will work to surface opportunities for optimization and testing. The ideal candidate is highly organized and detailed, possesses intermediate Excel skills, and is eager and excited to learn and grow alongside our team.

As our CRM Associate you will be joining the performance marketing team, reporting directly to our Director of CRM and working closely with our CRM Manager. You will also be partnering with the creative and brand marketing teams.

How You'll Make an Impact

  • Support the development and implementation of email campaigns
  • Own and maintain the marketing email content calendar
  • Identify opportunities for A/B testing and analyze results to provide recommendations for improvement
  • Partner with our copy and creative teams to brainstorm messaging concepts and tactics
  • Collaborate with other members of the team to translate strategic vision into tactical campaigns that drive key KPIs
  • Own the weekly reporting on campaign performance

Why We Need You

  • 1+ years in a marketing role, customer-facing role, or quantitative role
  • Intermediate Excel skills; comfortable with vlookups, pivot tables, data visualization, etc.
  • Basic knowledge of HTML / CSS
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Strong communication skills
  • Empathetic and customer-focused
  • Eager and willing to learn alongside a team dedicated to coaching and development
  • Keen interest in developing quantitative and technical skills
  • Experience with ESPs (Braze would be a plus) and/or basic knowledge of SQL, a plus

Perks & Benefits

  • Remote Work Optional: Work from home, work from our NYC office, work from anywhere, you decide!
  • Competitive compensation + comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits
  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Monthly Hungryroot credit
  • Universal paid parental leave
  • 401k
  • Commuter benefits
  • A working environment filled with passionate, happy, smart people!

#LI-REMOTE

Hungryroot is built on the values of being proactive, positive, and transparent in all that we do. Our mission to help make healthy eating easy, accessible, and joyful is better served by a diverse workplace.

We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer committed to building an inclusive workplace. We have zero-tolerance for harassment or discrimination. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, ethnicity, national origin, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Reporting to the Head of Marketing, the marketing manager will have expertise of marketing in a B2B environment, guiding how we develop and deliver products, activities, events and campaigns and ensuring our content and campaigns resonate with our audience. They will be responsible for the successful delivery of all in market marketing programmes and the effective launch of new products and services.


Who We Are

The Drum is a leading global publisher for the marketing and media industries. Our mission is to help our 1.2-plus million readers and customers prepare for what’s next. We provide actionable insights, guidance, inspiration and solutions. Each day we offer a deeper take on what’s important for our community—of thinkers, doers, creators and innovators. We aim to be their global solutions source, helping them solve the problems they face every day.

We do this via the drum.com where, as well as delivering great content, we host conferences and industry awards, provide content publishing solutions, access to exclusive networks, bring together buyers and sellersof marketing services and share research and insights,

Our team works across our key global markets, and we have offices in London, Glasgow, New York, Singapore and Mumbai.

To help us achieve global growth, we are hiring specialist marketers for each of our key regions. Responsible for implementing product campaigns and activities, the Marketing Manager will connect with colleagues locally and centrally from product, sales and marketing.


Responsibilities

  • To work closely with product, sales and customer group specialists to create effective customer packages.
  • Work with the product and the marketing colleagues to devise and deliver successful marketing regional or market specific campaigns.
  • Provide expert knowledge for the region. Understanding and identifying cultural variations and changed expectations, feeding into product leaders, marketing, and sales team.
  • Identify market opportunities and provide strategic recommendations on new potential area for product or business development.
  • Maximise audience, customer, and revenue growth from the region.
  • Generate leads for the sales team and support growth in online sales
  • Work closely with the data and insights teams to increase market intelligence and grow member data.
  • Influence and create regional products and packages, developing marketing plans and implementing activities and events.
  • Measure, analyse and report on the success of in-market campaigns and suggest strategies for continual improvement.
  • Support the sales team to achieve regional growth and sales targets.
  • Collaborate with colleagues across the marketing function too ensure the effective delivery of global initiatives in market.

Requirements

  • Proven expertise in-market and experience of leading successful campaigns
  • A background in a relevant sector and in a marketing role, ideally with a working knowledge of brands, agencies, and digital suppliers.
  • Experience of working with global and regional sales and marketing teams, generating demand and leads through localized marketing programmes.
  • Ability to think creatively and problem solve, with a working knowledge of the latest digital marketing tools and techniques.
  • Comfortable working with data and technology platforms to deliver successful campaign outcomes.
  • Experience of liaising across multiple teams and time zones, with excellent co-operation and communication skills
  • Demonstrable evidence of organizing and delivering successful activities and events at a regional level.
  • Evidence of monitoring and tracking campaign success and implementing change for future activities.
  • High standard of spoken and written English as business language.

Benefits

  • 401k
  • Comprehensive healthcare package
  • Sick & Safe time off
  • Life cover
  • Vacation time - 30 days in total (22 days + 8 federal holidays)
  • 2 additional paid charity days per annum (support a charitabl cause that is close to you without taking vacation days)

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager (Senior), fully remote (f/*/m)
jobs.description:
Location: No location restrictions, we hire remotely worldwide 🌍

Language: We operate internally and externally in English (US)

Hours: 40 hours per week for full-time. You're free to choose your own hours as long as there's some overlap during the daytime of our CET team for meetings and other internal culture events

Part-time options: We'll consider part-time options for this role, please mention what you're looking for in your application

Salary: Starting at €61,000 - €85,500 for full-time

Note: We've defined a salary range for this role based on the level of initiative and experience we're looking for. This isn't the “limit” and there's room for you to grow at Frontastic.


---------------------------------------—


You'll be part of our fast-growing Marketing team, acting as the glue between our Marketing and Product teams. You'll provide input to our product development process based on market insights, personas, and use cases.


🔥 What you'll be responsible for
  • Act as the liaison between and work closely with our Product and Marketing teams, providing input based on market insights, personas, and use cases in order to define product communication plans, develop marketing materials, and coordinate features releases
  • Take product value propositions and turn this into clear product positioning and marketing messaging, from which our marketing and communication strategies can be defined to support the sales process
  • Scout and analyze the market and technology trends, the evolving needs of our ideal customers, and our competitors
  • Develop an effective product positioning strategy as input for the product and marketing teams
  • Defining value propositions, personas, and messaging for each use case of the product, together with our Product team
  • Develop internal and external marketing and sales materials such as:
    • Product content such as texts and videos
    • Training materials
    • Product and sales presentations
    • Customer case studies
    • Analyst and press briefings
  • Partner with our Customer Success team to actively manage and maximize the customer lifecycle value
  • Work closely together with our Sales and Partner Management team to actively support the sales process
  • Represent Frontastic as a ‘Composable Frontend Evangelist’ (both from a technical and marketing perspective) in presentations, webinars, meet-ups, conferences, and other formats with relevant, industry or case-related keynotes, presentations, interviews, or other formats.
  • There will be some need to travel to attend in-person industry events


🤔 What's it like working in our Marketing team?

“We're a small, dedicated team with a strong digital focus. Our thirst for learning drives us, and we're constantly scanning trends and monitoring our competition to continuously improve every single day.” — Helen, Head of Marketing


💪 What you'll accomplish in your first 90-days
  • Take the time in your first weeks to meet your Frontastic colleagues and see our values in action, learning more about what they are and how they drive us
  • Deep dive into the Frontastic product and our positioning with our Product and Marketing teams
  • Develop the product marketing roadmap for Q1 and Q2 of 2022 together with Peter, our Chief Product Officer, and Helen, our Head of Marketing


🧩 You'll likely have this experience
  • 3 or more years experience in working as a Product Marketer in a software company
  • A strong understanding of the eCommerce space from a product and business perspective
  • You know how Product, Sales, and Marketing teams work and you're experienced in cross-functional communication and project management
  • Comfortable translating technical concepts into marketing speech and vice-a-versa
  • You're able to build networks and get in touch with others quickly
  • Have previously managed multiple projects simultaneously


👏 We're offering:
  • A remote setup and processes tailored for remote workers
  • The freedom of planning your work around life and not the other way round — we want you to bring your full self to work, and this includes owning your daily routines
  • A company laptop of your choice and a personal budget for any additional equipment you need — you'll be able to purchase it yourself with a virtual company credit card
  • A 5-day yearly retreat where we meet with the whole team and spend time together at a beautiful place for additional social bonding


🤝 Our hiring process

We've designed our hiring process with the candidate experience in mind. This is important to us as we know to build the best product possible, we need the best people. Learn more about our hiring process.

🕒 We aim to respond to all candidates within 72 hours (except weekends).

1️⃣ Submit your application to our team for review

2️⃣ Discovery call (60min) with Helen, our Head of Marketing, to discuss the role, our culture, and find out if it's a good alignment with your own preferences and skills

3️⃣ Culture questions (via email) to see how you approach important topics such as growth and work planning

4️⃣ First interview (60min) with Peter, our Chief Product Officer, to discuss your approach to product marketing and a deep dive into product positioning

5️⃣ Second Interview (60mins) with Heidi, our Product Lead, and Zoya, our Social Media and Content Marketer to discuss the Product and Marketing teams, and find out more about you personally

6️⃣You'll be invited to a stakeholder lunch (30min) where you'll get the opportunity to meet informally with some of your co-workers in our product and engineering teams


👣 About us

We're a fully remote company, and we've been working that way since being founded in 2017.

Frontastic is a Composable Frontend Platform that unites business and development teams to build commerce sites on top of headless. Our customers see higher conversion rates, increased developer productivity, and a faster time to market.

As of November 2021, Frontastic has officially become part of commercetools- we're growing fast and continue to work focused on our mission: Let commerce teams build the incredible. Do you want to be part of this exciting journey? 🚀

If you want to learn more about our product, watch our product demo video.


💬 We'd love to hear from you

If you've any questions about the role, email our Talent team at people@frontastic.cloud. Applications will only be accepted directly through the job application form.

Visit our careers page on our website to find out more about our organization and culture.


If this role isn't for you, but you know of someone who'd be a great fit, we'd really appreciate it if you'd share this role with them!


We're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We don't discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Enrollment Marketing Manager (Digital Health & Benefits)
jobs.description:
Ovia Health's women’s and family health solutions are trusted by millions around the world — to help them monitor their reproductive health, navigate their journeys through parenthood, and find support every day. We're on a mission to make a healthy, happy family possible for everyone. Join us!

We are looking for a Enrollment Marketing Manager who is passionate about modernizing women’s healthcare and family-first benefits. You will be a critical member of the Marketing team who will partner closely with Product Management, Channel partner management, and Client Success to introduce new solutions to the market (members of self-insured employers, health plans, medicaid plans and government programs), and support the growth of our solution membership. A strong candidate has a proven track record of launching and commercializing successful products to members via health plan (commercial and Medicaid), self-insured employers, and government sponsors.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Launch, manage, and optimize end-to-end participant enrollment and engagement campaigns across multiple channels and target audiences. Develop and manage growth and enrollment campaigns for solution membership - define, monitor, measure and report on campaign performance and monthly Key Performance Indicators.
  • Deeply understand our members, clients (employers, health plans, and Medicaid plans), and channel partners (benefit consultants and wellness platforms), and translate this into messaging and assets that clearly demonstrate our differentiation, solution benefits, services and features.
  • Partner closely with Marketing, Product, and Client Success to build and optimize marketing plans for solution participant growth and engagement. Build plans in context of channel opportunities and restraints, using proven push/pull techniques such as incentives program integration.
  • Collaborate closely with our clients and channel partners to develop and release multi-channel marketing plans that drive best in class enrollment.
  • Develop acquisition marketing and experimentation roadmap for ongoing optimization. Bring fresh ideas and data-driven proposals to Marketing, Product and Finance for new budget, campaigns, product features, and tools to support user growth objectives. Forecast and report on expected volume and acquisition marketing plan results on a monthly basis.
  • Be a key contributor in product release planning to create assets that resonate with prospective members (women and parents) and drive enrollment.
  • Closely monitor, measure, and report on campaign performance, in addition to performing ad-hoc analysis.
  • Partner with editorial and design teams to develop compelling assets that will drive channel and campaign performance
  • Develop creative briefs for landing pages, ad copy and other creative elements needed for campaign execution, and oversee implementation and delivery of them to meet your campaign goals.
  • Develop and implement bid, keyword, and targeting strategies for paid media, including but not limited to: paid search, display, and paid social.
  • Support general manager and finance with analysis and market intelligence to inform pricing and packaging for our solutions.
  • Inspire confidence externally in product demonstrations that illustrate our solution's ability to meet the needs of our clients and the members they serve.
  • Lead virtual and on-site events (partnering closely with customer success) that drive awareness and enrollment.
  • Monitor and measure all campaign performance and ROI at aggregate and client by client level.
  • Develop and manage the creation of campaigns, assets, and content across a variety of channels and mediums, e.g. web landing pages, demo videos, brochures, virtual and onsite event materials, etc.
  • Outline strategy and plan to leverage Ovia’s Consumer channels and reach into Enrollment Campaigns.

Requirements:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience working on a Product Marketing or Digital Acquisition team, preferably at a fast-based, mobile first company
  • Experience in B2B and/or B2B2C marketing to health plans (Commercial and Medicaid), employers and/or health systems preferred
  • In-depth knowledge of top social media and marketing platforms, ad-serving and performance-monitoring software
  • Proven track record of managing media budgets and hitting monthly and annual goals for member acquisition, engagement, retention, and other KPIs
  • Experience leveraging data to inform campaign design and optimize performance
  • Thrives in fast paced environments, embracing and leading through change and ambiguity
  • Flexible and creative mindset with the ability to overcome obstacles with a positive outlook
  • Meticulous attention to detail
  • High autonomy, and superior time and project management skills
  • Outstanding communication (written and verbal) and relationship building skills
  • Agile, creative, and analytical mindset who is consistently evolving and growing
  • Proven track record of launching and commercializing successful products, performing landscape analysis, pricing, product positioning, and sales enablement
  • Demonstrated experience managing and marketing healthcare and benefits solutions throughout their lifecycle from concept through sale, post sale, implementation, enrollment campaigns and results monitoring, retention and renewal
  • Exceptional business acumen and product landscape knowledge
  • Proven ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams
  • Ability to connect product releases and campaigns to company mission, goals and KPIs
  • In-depth knowledge of top social media and marketing platforms, and performance-monitoring software
  • Experience leveraging data to inform campaign design and optimize performance
  • Superior autonomy, time and project management skills

Benefits:

We are a lively, creative team that works hard and laughs a lot. We love what we do, and working at Ovia Health is a chance to be a part of something truly impactful. We value our employees tremendously and do what we can to help them stay happy and healthy, at work and away from it. In addition to a supportive and healthy environment, we offer:

  • Small, dynamic and tight-knit team
  • Supportive, collaborative atmosphere
  • Growth and education stipend
  • Company provided MacBook Pro
  • Paid vacation and sick leave
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Tasty office snacks, including coffee (cold brew on tap)
  • An open, cubicle-free office space, as well as the ability to be fully office-optional
  • Multiple options for medical insurance coverage
  • Dental and Vision insurance through Principal
  • Company-paid Life and Disability insurance coverage
  • Employer contribution to 401k
  • Generous parental leave

Ovia is now an “office-optional” employer, meaning we welcome remote applicants from across the United States.

We actively seek to reflect the community that we serve, and so individuals of all genders, race, sexual orientation, nationality, ability, veteran status, and educational background are strongly encouraged to apply.

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketer
jobs.description:
At Doist, our mission is to inspire the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity tools that promote a more fulfilling way to work and live.

We're a multidisciplinary, fully remote team of 90+ people who are passionate about creating products, like Todoist and Twist, that improve people’s lives. We thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and we seek to rethink how productivity tools are made.

Our Core Values

They are few, but they are mighty. From creating processes to decision-making and recruiting, we build our five core values into nearly every single thing we do.

  • Independence. Others can trust that you’ll deliver on time and your teammates don’t need to worry about you keeping your word.
  • Mastery. You love what you do and care deeply about the quality of your work, down to the smallest details. You’re continuously learning and pushing yourself to the limits of your ability. You're never satisfied with the status quo.
  • Communication. Your communication is clear, concise, and engaging whether you're explaining a complex idea or providing feedback to a teammate.
  • Ambition & Balance. You aspire to put a dent in the universe. To do this, you set high standards for yourself and those around you. The time you spend on work isn’t measured by quantity, but by quality.
  • Impact. You're able to take a bird's eye view to pinpoint and then solve issues that have a high impact on our customers, our team, and our company. You're committed to the health and success of both your teammates and Doist as a company.

We invite you to visit our blog to learn more about us, our values, and how we work.

Your Role

As the product marketer dedicated to Twist, you'll collaborate with nearly every other team at Doist to bring the product to life across Twist’s existing (and potential) user base. You’ll balance analytics and creativity when devising marketing campaigns to showcase anything from a small bug fix to a massive feature release. With your counterpart on the product team, you’ll dive deep into learning about Twist’s users, how they use the app, and how best to communicate with them.

On a day-to-day basis you’ll:

  • Plan, develop and execute product marketing campaigns of varying scopes for Twist.
  • Collaborate with marketers, brand designers, and full-stack developers to showcase Twist across multiple marketing channels.
  • Dig into data and speak with Twist users in order to understand our user lifecycle and how the app solves peoples’ pain points (and how it could solve others).
  • Write and edit copy of varying lengths, from a Twist changelog to a Twist blog post.
  • Review and suggest improvements to Twist’s existing product marketing tools like lifecycle emails, the Twist website, and Twist app store descriptions.
  • Engage in co-marketing activities with third-party developers and partners.

About you

It's important to us that the person we hire can thrive and be successful in this role. To do so, you have relevant experience:

  • Managing data-informed, high-impact marketing campaigns of varying scopes that achieve key business goals.
  • Researching customers in order to map out the nuances of a user lifecycle.
  • Writing and producing short-form and long-form product-related blog posts, videos, guides, and/or other types of content with various writing styles.
  • Defining go-to-market strategies and positioning products and brands.
  • Thinking out of the box for unique and creative ways to communicate product details with users across a wide spectrum of marketing channels.
  • Mastering SEO, traffic analytics, email analytics, marketing data dashboards, CMS, technical product specs, development workflows, support workflows, GitHub, and more.
  • Prioritizing several different projects with requests from multiple stakeholders to hit moving deadlines.

Requirements

Not sure the role is a good fit for you? That's okay! We'd still be happy to consider you. Here's what the process will look like:

  1. Submit your complete application. This including a resume (or manually entered experience) and thoughtful responses to all the application questions. No cover letter needed!
  2. Application screening. We read every application to understand your motivation, skills, and experience. Once your application has been reviewed, you'll receive a response regarding the status of your application typically within one week. Don't panic if it takes a bit longer, everyone will get a response.
  3. Value-alignment interview with Hugo (Product).
  4. We'll ask you to complete a take-home test project.
  5. Test project and marketing interview with Aer P. (Product Marketer)
  6. Culture contribution and values interview with Brenna L. (CMO)

Benefits

Our perks and benefits are designed to provide the freedom and support you need to grow personally and professionally. Here’s what that looks like:

The basics

  • Work from anywhere in the world. We never place restrictions on locations.
  • Design your own schedule. Work no more than 40 hours/week.
  • Competitive pay. Our formula-based salary calculation provides a highly competitive rate based on your skills and location.

Expand your professional skills

  • Pursue personal projects. All Doisters get one month per year to spend on a work-related project they’re passionate about
  • Attend conferences. You’ll have a recurring budget to spend on attending conferences that grow your professional knowledge, skills, and network.
  • Company retreats. Our annual company-wide retreats are unforgettable.

Craft your ideal work environment

  • Cozy up at a coworking space. Find a coworking space that’s right for you and Doist will cover the expense.
  • Apps and services budget. You’ll have a monthly budget to spend on services that help you do your job.
  • Hardware budget. You’ll have access to a recurring budget to spend on work-related equipment.

Focus on your well-being

  • Generous time off. Doisters get 8 weeks (40 days) of PTO/year to use as they wish on vacations and national holidays.
  • Parental leave. New parents receive 5 weeks of paid parental leave in addition to 13 weeks of paid pregnancy-related medical leave.
  • Invest in your health and wellness. You’ll have a monthly budget to spend on things like gym membership, healthy snacks, massages, health insurance, etc.

---

All information collected through this application is stored in Workable, Doist’s Applicant Tracking System, where it will be used for recruitment purposes only. For more information on how we handle candidate data at Doist, we invite you to review our recruitment privacy notice. For questions, please contact us at careers@doist.com (managed by Andrew G. & Mitch N. from People Operations).

jobs.title: Brand Designer
jobs.description:
As a brand designer at Stack Overflow, you’ll be responsible for creating and evolving our brand. You’ll be crafting creative for our technical audience across projects that span every medium - video & animation, website design, emails, editorial design, physical spaces, swag, internal communications, in-product illustration, and everything in between.

The brand design team is a small team embedded in the marketing department, but works with stakeholders throughout the company as well as our network of freelance illustrators and designers. Brand design and product design teams maintain close links (through cross-function critiques and design exercises & projects) and our culture strongly emphasizes collaboration over competition, so you’ll be working with folks who are eager to help each other grow and succeed. 

 

What You’ll Do:

  • Work on our numerous ‘go-to-market’ campaigns with our product marketing and sales team, driven by the evolution of our services: Stack Overflow for Teams, Stack Overflow Advertising & Employer Branding (formerly Talent) and Collectives on Stack Overflow™.
  • Strategize, plan and design wider brand awareness campaigns - recent examples include The Key and Reputation Awards for our public platform users.
  • Help with the day-to-day designs Marketing needs of the company - internal & external presentations, display ads, email graphics, ‘one-pagers’.
  • Collaborate closely with our content & communications teams on both designing and art directing illustration, social content for editorial and videos for our Blog and Podcast.
  • Advise and assist our product design team on decisions which affect the micro and macro of our brand. Contributions are expected to be formalized in our design system - including in product iconography, illustration and typography.
  • Design & art direction for our recurring community projects such as Winter Bash and Developer Survey.
  • Creating all the marketing collateral (web design, banner ads, PDFs, emails, videos etc) for new headline features for Stack Overflow for Teams for example we recently launched a new Free tier.
  • Briefing and managing our network of freelancers we use for the Blog.
  • Presentations for when teammates speak at public events on behalf of Stack Overflow.
  • Internal and external ‘swag’ - recent projects include The Key.
  • Digital design for our homepage and other marketing sites.
  • Working with the design system team to create templates and guidelines, such as our ever growing icon set for the product and brand projects.
  • Participating in critique sessions with the wider design team, both sync and async.

What You’ll Need:

  • A portfolio detailing your process and final work (please include a link or attachment, we won’t consider applications without one).
  • We’re flexible on years of experience (and therefore title & salary), but you have on-the-job design experience at an agency, in-house, or freelance. Internships count!

jobs.title: Marketing Specialist
jobs.description:
About Sora

Sora’s mission is to empower people-focused teams to create exceptional employee experiences. These teams should be spending time with people, but unfortunately all facets of People teams are bogged down by managing processes instead of helping people. That’s where Sora comes in: we’re building a product that streamlines the tedious and repetitive work People teams do every day, from sending emails to assigning onboarding tasks to a new hire’s manager to syncing data across anywhere from 3 to 20 tools in a customer’s HR stack.

 

We’re a pure startup, with all the excitement that carries as a foundational member, but with more thoughtfulness than the typical early-stage company. We’re committed to our values and we take our mission seriously. Employee experience is in our DNA — we invest in processes that are inclusive and fair, and we invest in our long-term mental, physical, and emotional health.

 

Sora was founded in late 2018 and launched in 2020. We’ve fundraised from some of the best investors in the world and prioritize keeping a diverse group of investors and advisors.

 

Sora is committed to being a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

 

Job Overview

Marketing specialists at Sora are responsible for generating qualified sales leads. We create those leads through a combination of inbound website traffic, outbound campaigns, and digital & in-person events. We do that by presenting Sora, both as a company and a product, as an entity that understands the problems our audience faces and the solutions they need. And that means, above all, by being thoughtful and empathetic.

 

Marketing uses tools like Webflow, Figma, Outreach.io, Google Analytics, and Salesforce to run these campaigns and warmly hand off leads to our sales team. 

 

While maintaining our established lead channels, marketing specialists work strategically to experiment and develop new channels that will generate qualified leads.

Your Impact and Responsibilities

In your first 30 days at Sora you’ll have the opportunity to impact the trajectory of the company directly, by drawing learnings from every aspect of the go to market funnel and transmitting them back to the rest of the org, including:

  • Creating blog posts and digital content that appeals to our audience, the problems they are facing, and the solutions they are seeking

  • Collaborating with Sales to experiment with audiences and messaging to help the company learn who our best customers are and how to best message them

  • Understanding our existing marketing channels and how they are run

 

 Within 90 days you’ll be:

  • Collaborating with Sora customers to tell their stories of success with Sora

  • Participating in in-person events that allow us to bring Sora to our audience at HR events and conferences

  • Being a Subject Matter Expert in the HR automation space

  • Contributing ideas and executing on plans for new sources of website traffic and channels for qualified leads

  • Master using Sora, being able to both explain the product and learn how it can be valuable to our audience, helping refine our pitch and company narrative

We’re looking for someone who has:

  • Hands-on marketing experience

  • Flexibility and a zeal for fast paced, ever-changing work environments

  • Willingness to learn about HR processes, its software, and their pain points

  • A passion for problem solving, new technology, and compassion for the pain of pandemic and post-pandemic HR organizations

  • Excellent communication skills

  • Self-directed, a quick study, and an enthusiastic team player

  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage time and resources effectively

  • An analytical mindset that is determined to make data-informed decisions

  • Intellectual curiosity and is unafraid to ask questions or collaborate with cross-functional teams

  • Seeking professional development (open to being coached/mentored)

jobs.title: Content Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
About Twic 

Twic is a modern-day benefits platform that gives employees the freedom to choose health and wellness programs that are right for them. Employers have begun to realize that there is no one-size-fits-all design when it comes to employee benefits. We are doing the difficult-but-necessary work to help employers deliver benefits in a personalized way at scale to improve the cost structure and the employee experience. 

We’ve helped companies like Stripe, Zoom, Allbirds, Square and Twitch redesign their employee benefits using an employee-centric approach.Twic is a fully-remote and distributed team with employees all over the world. We are growing quickly and have more than tripled the size of the team in the last year. Now is a great time to join Twic! 

 

About the role 

The Content Marketing Manager exists to oversee Twic's content strategy and guide our content marketing strategy, facilitate ongoing content planning, manage day-to-day content creation, editing and promotion, and report on the results of each content marketing initiative.

This is a pivotal role for building and maintaining the Twic brand through tone and creativity. The content marketing manager will create content for blogs, marketing collateral, articles, product descriptions, social media, and the company website among others. The content writer's responsibilities include evaluating analytics to adjust content as needed, and regularly updating the company's website.

To be successful as a content marketing manager, you should be proficient with the latest SEO and social media techniques. Ultimately, the role is responsible for the development and implementation of strategies that will increase reader engagement.

 

You will 

  • Conduct in-depth research on industry-related topics in order to develop original content

  • Analyze competitors’ content, messaging and distribution tactics

  • Identify and understand target audiences and their key demographics, interests, and online behavior

  • Identify customers’ needs and recommending new content to address gaps in the company's current content

  • Conduct keyword research and using SEO best practices to increase traffic to the company website

  • Create an editorial calendar with specific, measurable goals and a timeline

  • Develop content for blogs, ebooks, white papers, articles, infographics, product descriptions, social media, and the company website etc.

  • Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of published content

  • Assist the marketing team in developing content for advertising campaigns

  • Collaborate with the design team in developing polished marketing materials

  • Proofread content for errors and inconsistencies and ensure adherence to our style guide and improve readability

  • Leverage social media experience to promote and drive engagement

 

Preferred Skills

  • 5+ years working as a content marketer

  • Strong project management skills, the ability to manage multiple tasks and responsibilities, and experience working under time constraints is a must

  • Proven content writing and copywriting experience especially as it pertains to mid-market and enterprise audiences

  • Demonstrated ability to understand complex terminology and technical materials

  • Working knowledge of content management systems (e.g. Hubspot, Guru)

  • A portfolio of published articles and assets

  • Excellent writing and editing skills with attention to detail

  • The ability to work in a fast-paced environment

  • The ability to handle multiple projects concurrently

  • Technical writing experience ideal, but not necessary

  • Experience writing in the benefits or HR space ideal, but not necessary

 

Benefits and Perks

  • Remote-first working environment

  • Medical, dental and vision insurance plans

  • Employee wellness program

  • Home Productivity program

  • Team building program

  • 401(k) savings plan

  • Flexible PTO policy

 

At Twic, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

 

Duties and responsibility may not all be covered in the description or may change over time at the discretion of Twic. You're encouraged to apply even if your experience doesn't precisely match the job description. Your skills and passion will stand out—and set you apart—especially if your career has taken some extraordinary twists and turns. At Twic, we welcome diverse perspectives and people who think rigorously and aren't afraid to challenge assumptions. Join us.

jobs.title: Lifecycle / Growth Marketing Lead
jobs.description:
Hero: taking the hassle out of taking meds.
 
We’re on a mission to help take the hassle out of taking meds for patients and caregivers with the first end-to-end medication management service that stores, sorts, dispenses, tracks and refills even the most complex regimens. 
 
Did you know that only 50% of U.S. patients take their meds as prescribed? It’s true. Medication non-adherence is a $300 billion dollar healthcare problem that claims up to 125,000 lives in the U.S. each year and accounts for up to 30% of all U.S. hospitalizations.  
 
At Hero, we’re tackling this crisis head-on with an award-winning smart device which stores and dispenses up to a 90-day supply of 10 different medications, a connected medication management app, automatic prescription refills with free delivery, and 24/7 live support. 
 
The Hero team is highly-driven, mission-oriented and growing quickly –– we hope you’ll join us in improving the lives of millions of patients and caregivers across the country!
 
We are looking for a Lifecycle / Growth Marketing Lead with a proven experience driving impact across the lifecycle (activation, engagement, re-engagement) via digital channels (in-product, email). You will be responsible for the end-to-end lifecycle marketing initiatives (ideation, execution and reporting), develop & optimize programs across channels to drive member engagement and retention. This role will work closely with cross-functional groups including: Engineering, Product, UX, Data, Revenue and Marketing, to help build holistic growth-focused revenue-generating initiatives along the member lifecycle. 
 
This role requires a data-driven self-directed pro, who brings together creativity, analytical horsepower, and deep product understanding to rapidly and tirelessly find innovative ways to keep members engaged, retain them, and turn them into brand champions. You'll have access to multiple tools, as well as consumer behavior data, user research, member feedback, and experimentation performance, to maximize members’ retention, engagement and lifetime value.
 
Join us in bringing transformative healthcare products to market that improve the lives of millions!



Responsibilities
  • Identify key measurable metrics (upsell, churn, etc.) for lifecycle programs with the ability to test and scale rapidly.
  • Develop and execute growth marketing strategies for onboarding, retention, and lifecycle engagement across channels and member segments to create relevant personalized experiences; oversee the execution of highly targeted, complex member journeys / workflows and ad-hoc campaigns.
  • Establish a measurement & experimentation framework, relentlessly testing new ideas and digging deep creatively.
  • Use quantitative and qualitative data to prioritize efforts; collaborate cross-functionally (Marketing, Product, Data, Engineering, etc) to run iterative tests throughout the funnel, using the results to drive data-driven strategy updates that lift key performance metrics.
  • Own data measurement and reporting for lifecycle / marketing growth initiatives, and regularly communicate status, results and other key metrics to internal stakeholders.



Minimum Qualifications
  • BA/BS degree and 5+ years of B2C growth marketing experience focused on acquisition, adoption, loyalty and retention in a technology business. Proven track record of growth marketing strategies & programs aimed at the end-consumer, with demonstrated impact on lifecycle KPIs. Deep knowledge in customer segmentation, touchpoint analysis, CRM marketing, performance and digital marketing.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to learn new technologies, products and systems quickly.
  • Entrepreneurial and results-oriented approach, with strong testing and experimentation mindset; ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while prioritizing tasks and meeting timelines.
  • Strong organizational skills, with experience working collaboratively with Marketing, Data, Product, Design, and Engineering teams.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with an outstanding eye for detail. 



Preferred Qualifications
  • Experience working in an early-stage startup environment, leading marketing / lifecycle growth 
  • Experience marketing a consumer subscription product
  • Strong understanding of the most recent trends around consumer web usage including experience with SEO, social media and community building.
HERO is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
We value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, personality and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, ancestry, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Senior Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

     PickFu is a consumer research software company that helps companies and entrepreneurs make better-informed decisions about their products, designs, marketing, and more. Businesses across such industries as e-commerce, mobile gaming, and publishing use PickFu to gather consumer insights quickly and at a fraction of the cost of traditional market research surveys.

     We are looking for a seasoned professional to manage our in-house marketing team, develop and execute strategy, and lead PickFu into the next phase of growth. You will be joining a team that believes in honest tactics, high standards, and data-driven decision making. We value quality, integrity, and people over a quick profit. We pride ourselves on excellent customer service and a product that can sell itself—and need you to get the word out there.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Manage a small team of creatives, writers, and strategists. You’ll report directly to our co-founders.

  • Responsible for carrying out a metrics-driven marketing campaign and growth strategy to reach existing and new customers.

  • Own the top of the funnel metrics. Analyze data, measure impact, and revise as you go.

  • Anticipate hiring needs, actively participate in the recruitment process, and develop a yearly budget for the marketing team.

  • Analyze target market research to identify and recommend effective marketing approaches.

  • Oversee social media, email marketing, content management, conferences (in-person and virtual), and PPC and paid marketing initiatives. Manage all marketing initiatives.

  • Work with cross-functional teams to create a meaningful, cohesive brand experience.

  • Build and maintain relationships with marketing partners, external vendors, and other affiliates.


ABOUT YOU

  • You’re experienced. You have 4+ years of experience in a growth role as a Marketing Manager or Lead, executing marketing campaigns and managing a portfolio of diverse customers.

  • You’re a strong communicator. You have a way with words. You are a strong writer with strong feelings about grammar, punctuation, and passive voice. You are comfortable presenting and speaking in public.

  • You can tell a good story. You understand the value of brand positioning, and that informs everything your team creates.

  • You’re analytical. You have a soft spot for metrics and love to create actionable, data-driven decisions across all aspects of marketing. Bonus if you know SQL.

  • You’re a people person. You’re excited to step into a leadership role and ready to cheer on your colleagues. You’re infectiously optimistic and energetic. You enjoy leading a team and working closely with others.

  • You value relationships. We love our customers, but we also like the people we work with. As a member of PickFu, you will be a part of a dynamic, startup environment where you’ll help contribute to the success and culture of the company.

  • Location: We are a remote-work company so you can be located anywhere, but you'll need to be available during US hours (PST or EST).


NICE-TO-HAVE

  • Experience scaling a marketing team during a startup growth phase.

  • Comfortable working with diverse colleagues from different countries.

  • Familiarity with online tools including Asana, Google Docs, Notion, and Slack.

  • Worked remotely before, or know that you’d work well with a remote team.

  • Experience marketing to a global customer base in their native language.


TEAM, CULTURE, VALUES

     We have been fully remote since our start in 2008. We’re looking for creative, capable, and collaborative team members to join in and help build our momentum. As long as you have the skills and can get the work done, you can work anywhere (and anytime) you want.

     We are a small but mighty team. We appreciate friendly people who can solve problems, get along with others, and tell us how to be better. We also aim to live a happy, healthy life away from work. We believe in reasonable hours, ample vacation time, and fun hobbies.

     Communication is a big thing for us. We use Slack for chatting, Zoom for facetime, and Asana for planning. Our team meetings revolve around company updates, brainstorming sessions, feedback and check-ins, team building, and social events.

     At PickFu, we value diversity. We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply.


SALARY, BENEFITS, PERKS

  • Salary range for this position is begins at $110,000 with comprehensive benefits. Applicants from outside the United States will be offered a contractor role with comparable terms and equal pay with our domestic employees.

  • Unlimited PTO. Use it however you want. We believe in reasonable working hours and time away from the computer.

  • Our equipment policy allows for a standard MacBook Air (or equivalent), and we’ll even help you set up your workstation.

  • Professional development allowance towards education, books, or anything that you think will be beneficial in this role.

jobs.title: Director, Demand Generation
jobs.description:
Webflow is a visual web development platform that empowers non-coders to create incredible experiences for the web. 

Webflow is seeking a Demand Generation Director who will be responsible for the strategy, scale, and execution of marketing programs that capture and nurture marketing leads across multiple channels. As Director of Demand Generation, you will lead the expansion and growth of our marketing programs including lead generation campaigns, and integrated marketing programs. 

About the role 
  • Location: San Francisco HQ or US remote
  • Full-time

 

As a Director of Demand Generation, you’ll … 

  • Develop, design, lead, and execute on multi-touch, integrated demand generation and account-based marketing programs to drive qualified new enterprise business leads and nurture our existing database of leads.
  • Collaborate with Sales to continually optimize marketing lead conversion rates and own the company Marketing Qualified Leads (MQL) KPI.
  • Manage technical aspects of key marketing systems (marketing automation, account-based marketing, buyer intent, ad words, re-targeting, etc) used to generate, distribute, and report on leads.
  • Improve operational processes and reporting related to demand generation programs to measure effectiveness, performance and ROI of marketing spend.
  • Collaborate with the growth marketing, content marketing, product marketing and sales teams to develop (write, drive review process, publish) and promote marketing materials to drive awareness and interest.
  • Analyze campaign outcomes in detail, drawing insights and presenting results clearly to facilitate sound decision making and next steps.
  • Build, scale, and manage a high-performance team of demand generation managers, and integrated marketing managers, with end-to-end oversight of everything from hiring and recruiting strategy to coaching of your team.

That said, these responsibilities are just the start! At Webflow, we encourage you to contribute wherever your interests take you — and shape your role accordingly. And this isn’t just a philosophical bent: we actually give you 4 hours a week (10% of the work week) to pursue passion projects outside of your role responsibilities. 

About you 

You’ll thrive as a Director of Demand Generation if:

  • You have experience creating and driving demand generation strategies at high growth software companies — including online and offline programs.
  • You have previous experience leading demand generation teams leveraging a high volume self-serve funnel.
  • A track record of building and scaling ABM strategies and programs from scratch
  • Ability to partner with Product Marketing to build strategic narratives and operationalize tactics
  • You have experience with marketing & sales technologies such as Marketo, Iterable, and Salesforce.
  • You are passionate about the lead and customer lifecycle and establishing programs to support every stage.
  • You are an experienced people manager with a passion for coaching and developing your team members.
  • Experience leading marketing function at growing SaaS companies at scale 
  • You take full ownership of initiatives and are proactive about capturing new opportunities.

If you don’t meet 100% of the above qualifications, you should still seriously consider applying. Studies show that you can still be considered for a role if you meet just 50% of the role’s requirements.

About us 

At Webflow, we believe that what we’re doing doesn’t define our success -- so we focus on our “why” and “how”: 


Our Mission

To empower everyone to create for the web -- and lead impactful, fulfilling lives while we do it. 


Our core behaviors (how we act)

  2. Get it done, do it right 
  3. Practice candor with care
  4. Dream big, ship often 
Our commitments to you 
  • We’ll pay you! This is a full-time, salaried position that includes equity
  • We’ll invest in your physical and mental well-being with health, dental, and vision benefits and a monthly stipend for health and wellness expenses 
  • We’ll pay you to take a vacation … seriously. We’ll give you a $1,000 bonus for taking your first vacation with us that is more than 5 days 
  • We offer flexible parental leave 
  • We provide remote employees with the equipment they need to create a great remote work environment 
  • We will offer you the support you need to help you grow as an impactful Director of Demand Generation and a human being 
Ready to apply?

If you share our values and enthusiasm for empowering the world, we’d love to review your application! We promise we do take the time and care to review every application we receive. However, as much as we wish we could interview everyone who submits an application, we cannot guarantee an interview or feedback due to the unprecedented volume of applications we are receiving today. We are rooting for you, and hope you do consider applying.

Note: You'll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us.

jobs.title: Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
ABOUT FLOWN

FLOWN helps people work better. We do this by giving our members tools to focus, and tools to refuel.

Our platform offers a holistic approach, based on all the scientific research into what helps us become more productive, creative and fulfilled.

FLOWN is led by successful serial entrepreneur, Alicia Navarro, founder of Skimlinks (acquired by Connexity April 2020), and backed well-known entrepreneurs and angels such as Greg Marsh (OneFineStay), Taavet Hinrikus (Transferwise), Tom Allason (Shutl).

 

ABOUT THE ROLE

FLOWN launched earlier this year, and since then we've had great success with our initial marketing initiatives. We're now ready to accelerate our marketing efforts across a range of channels, so we're looking for new additions to our small but mighty team.

We are happy to receive applications from those who have some marketing experience, and we're also happy to receive applications from those at the start of their career. What's most important to us is that you are smart, creative, learn quickly, and will thrive in a fast-paced start up :).

This is a great opportunity to join the founding team of a company that will transform how people think and work. You'll work closely with senior management in bringing to life the FLOWN brand, and building up the growth function.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

As part of a team, you'll be responsible for attracting new members to FLOWN.

Depending on your skills and who else we hire, here are some of the things you could be doing day to day:

  • Designing and executing marketing campaigns that will attract people to FLOWN's website, and convert them into paying subscribers. These campaigns could involve a mix of channels eg paid social, PR, referral schemes, partnerships, email marketing etc.
  • Actively monitoring and analysing data to identify key insights and areas for improvement and product opportunities.
  • Developing partnerships with like-minded organisations, as well as communities favoured by our members, in order to identify opportunities to promote FLOWN, and deep work practices in general.
  • Managing our PR agency such that FLOWN is positioned as a thought-leader in deep work, and attracts new members.
  • Identifying other opportunities to position FLOWN as a thought-leader in deep work e.g. competitions.
  • Approaching businesses and positioning FLOWN as being a meaningful employee benefit.

Requirements

We're happy to consider people who've had some exposure to marketing, and we're happy to consider candidates who are earlier in their career. We just require that all candidates have the following experience:

  • Managing and coordinating a project, event, or similar.
  • Creating something independently - from idea to development.

If you have experience in any of the following it's an added bonus!

  • Designing ads and videos, and/or using tools like Canva.
  • Working with paid social platforms.
  • Writing great copy.
  • Managing PR, influencers, or other partners.

 

Most importantly here are the core attributes we think you'll need to succeed in the role:

  • Creative, with a customer mindset - you can come up with innovative ideas (for a range of mediums) that will appeal to our member-base. You're able to bring these ideas to life, relying on your technical know-how as well as your strong aesthetic.
  • Exceptional communication skills - you speak and write confidently and articulately. You understand the importance that words have, and can adapt your style depending on the audience. You get your message across succinctly, yet in a friendly way, and you care about things like spelling and grammar.
  • Organised, resilient, resourceful - you thrive in a fast-paced team, prioritise a busy workload, juggle multiple tasks, and work to quick-turnaround deadlines. You are unfazed when there's a lot on your plate or curveballs are thrown your way. When give a task we're all a bit unsure about, you can work independently to fill in the blanks and get it done.
  • Tech savvy and a lover of detail - you learn new systems quickly, and are comfortable navigating multiple screens and tools. Although you can work quickly, you can do so without making many mistakes.
  • Coachable and passionate - you are passionate about FLOWN's mission, and this passion comes across in your communications. You relish the idea of being hands-on in an early-stage business, and you have the ability to adapt and improve as required.
 
APPLYING

Please be sure to include a cover letter that addresses some of the points in this job description. It doesn't have to be a long cover letter, but we do want to learn more about you and your skills, and how they may fit within FLOWN.

Benefits

We want to practice what we preach, and build a company and team that works creatively and productively. Here are some of the benefits you'll gain from this role:

  • Scope and influence - you're joining the founding team and will be involved in shaping our product, what we do, and how we work.
  • A focus on deep work - we exist to support deep work among our members, so we support our staff in developing their own distraction-free deep work practice.
  • A strong team - we are led by a proven CEO & Founder, and the rest of the team is equally highly experienced. You'll learn a lot with us :)
  • Fully dispersed, flexible working - we are a remote-first company, and we've got lots of perks, tools and processes to make sure that works for everyone. We encourage individuals to establish working hours that enable them to work as productively as possible, and we understand that everyone needs a work/play balance.
  • Team socials - we get together regularly to collaborate and have fun. We also embed virtual activities and other surprises into our working days.

About Kuno Creative

Are you interested in becoming an employee-owner at a leading digital marketing agency and Diamond HubSpot partner? We are employee-owned, continuously on the frontlines of buyer engagement. We do marketing that matters, helping companies make the world a better place. This mission penetrates our daily lives and well-being, and, ultimately, enables us to help clients achieve measurable results. All company profits are distributed to Kuno employees each year.

Job Description

Do you have a passion for technology and marketing? Are you technically savvy and find satisfaction in providing solutions to complex challenges? If so, read on, you don’t want to miss out on this opportunity!

Geography

 

Kuno has a fully remote workforce consisting of the top talent across the country.

jobs.title: Manager, Growth Marketing and Campaigns
