Assignar's Growth Marketing Manager will be responsible for building the company's growth strategy, running all paid acquisition channels, and optimizing the lead and customer acquisition engine. This role will lead a small team of growth marketers and work closely with all marketing team members, sales and sales development as well as our media and creative partners.

This is a high impact role and will be an integral part of the marketing function at Assignar. We're looking for a highly motivated person who wants to put their ideas into action and grounds their decisions in data. In true start-up fashion, we move quickly with short sales cycles and need to build inbound growth and campaigns to match that pace. You will be reporting to the Global Head of Marketing.
__________________

What You'll Do

  • Operationally manage your team and our media agency to execute on the full marketing funnel including developing new concepts, launching and managing campaigns across paid marketing channels, developing a dynamic feedback loop with the sales teams, monitoring performance of online funnels and landing pages, and optimizing campaigns
  • Lead deep-dive analyses across all paid marketing channels and campaigns to identify new growth/efficiency opportunities, identify and experiment with new marketing channels based on performance results.
  • Test and optimize marketing campaigns across a variety of channels, such as PPC, video, social media, display, retargeting, 3rd party paid media vendors and others. Thinking analytically and creatively to build data-driven campaigns that grow pipeline and exceed growth targets.

At a Minimum, We'd Like You to Have

      About Assignar

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
About Us

We are growing fast and looking for amazing people to join our team and contribute to our growth!   

Working with us is a chance to help bring some of the world's most cutting-edge music and visual experiences to life, in an unconventional company where we respect skill, determination, creativity and kindness above all.

We are adventurers on a sea of information, using analytics and constant experimentation to make data-driven choices.  A role with us is a chance to work at the very edge of marketing technology and technique, helping improve people's lives by constantly experimenting, imagining possibilities; even inventing tools that don't exist yet.

We are driven by:  

• The desire to be the absolute best in our field.
• A passion to join art that improves people's lives with its audiences.
• The belief that it is a moral imperative to bring great art to audiences, and to bypass traditional industry gatekeepers.
• An overarching philosophy that says data science and artistry aren't in opposition.
• A wish to leave a legacy, and to help others leave theirs.

Job Summary:

*This is a remote role*
We are looking for an innovative leader with a strong background in high-spend digital marketing campaigns to develop our marketing team, implement our existing strategies and dream up and test new strategies and tactics.  The role will be centred on planning, designing and coordinating campaigns promoting movie and music releases, live and immersive experiences, and associated merchandise.  The marketing manager will be reporting directly to our CEO/CMO who will retain strategic oversight, since our marketing approach and systems are one the company's key products.  

Our work is heavily PPC based, focussing mainly (although not exclusively) on the Meta ecosystem, so in addition to having an imaginative/strategic mindset, we would prefer someone with deep experience as a media buyer themselves.   Our approach is detail and data-driven, and definitely wouldn't suit an old-fashioned hands-off Mad-men whisky-and-whiteboard marketeer.  You need to be able to talk data and experimentation at a deep level with your team and the CMO, and be completely comfortable with all the tech, including running media buying yourself if need-be (as will probably be the case early as we are hiring).

The marketing team as a whole has responsibilities towards the rest of our operation.  We will be looking to you to design a team to carry these out at scale, initially handling many of them yourself in order to fully understand them and tweak systems.  As our operation builds in 2022 we will be looking to you to build a team to take some of these over, agreeing a plan and budget with the CMO. Those team responsibilities are listed in a separate section below.

 

Who this role will suit:

• You are fascinated by behaviour, and spend your days thinking about innovative ways of reaching people and stirring them into action.
• You see marketing not purely as a hard-sales tool, but as a way to control information flow, and to introduce people to things that will genuinely improve their lives.
• You are detail-oriented, yet frequently think big picture.
• You take a data-driven ‘hypothesise and test' approach to devising campaigns and strategies to maximise LTV, ROAS and conversion rates, and can demonstrate past campaigns you've been involved in which demonstrated remarkable value.
• You've been all over the iOS 14/Facebook pixel issues, and can immediately list a range of mitigation approaches, along with data about what does and doesn't work.
• You are good at people management and lead with encouragement not reproach.
• You are imaginative and encourage imagination in others without being threatened by it.
• You are a team player, happy to engage with the CEO/CMO on strategy and to fully get ‘all of the neurons' in your team firing.
• You are able and happy to work flexibly, sometimes late in the evening and at weekends (as we are liaising with the US west coast and putting on shows at weekends). We endeavour to make up for peaks of activity with time off at other times - no-one works well exhausted.

Marketing Team responsibilities

These are things the team needs to do for our business to function.  The Marketing Manager will initially be directly responsible for implementing these, while planning hires to take over some or all of them as you see fit, allowing us to scale without friction.

  • Creating, testing, managing and monitoring parallel geotargeted campaigns/funnels in multiple cities simultaneously.
  • PPC implementation/testing, minimum 2 x daily monitoring, bidding, risk control.
  • Setting up and managing (in conjunction with Customer Service and our Merchandise team) products and tickets for shows.
  • Liaison with venues re how they are represented in our marketing.
  • Regularly maintaining and updating the company knowledge base, so new systems and knowledge aren't trapped in people's heads.
  • Measuring and reporting on the performance of marketing campaigns, providing near real-time insights to other teams.
  • Conducting market research, sales forecasting, and strategic planning to assess and ensure the sale and profitability of products.
  • Conducting price split-testing, research and analysis to maximise city-specific price/ROAS.
Supervisory Responsibilities
  • Recruits, interviews, hires, and trains new staff in the department ensuring clear division of labour, in order to best achieve the Marketing Team Responsibilities listed below.
  • Prepares and monitors the marketing budget on a quarterly and annual basis and allocate funds.
  • Oversees the daily workflow of the department.
  • Provides constructive and timely team performance evaluations.  
  • Handles discipline and termination of employees in accordance with company policy.
  • Composes, develops, evaluates, and conducts training on marketing activities, strategies, and policies.
Direct Responsibilities 
  • Planning, design + coordinate campaigns.  Primarily these will be PPC campaigns on the Meta ecosystems.
  • Dreaming up and testing other possible ways of increasing engagement, awareness and ROAS - e.g. new creatives, other digital platforms, printed media, cross-media work.
  • Coordinating risk management - organising checking of ROAS and bids across multiple campaigns 1-2x daily including on weekends (our daily ad spend is likely to exceed $50k in 2022).
  • Liaison with:
    • CEO/CMO on strategy, team structure and budget
    • Sales team, feeding back sales and ROAS data and advising on booking strategy/timeline for each show in each venue
    • Systems team, to develop new systems, tools and dashboards, as we dream them up
    • Venues, to negotiate co-marketing
    • Show/product selection committees and development teams, to give marketing/demographic feedback
    • Our ticketing partners
  • Staying on top of trends and developments in the market; identifying new products, services and tools we might use, and making recommendations to leadership.
  • Coordinating promotional activities for trade shows.
  • Negotiating contracts for services needed to execute a marketing strategy. 
  • Performing other duties as assigned. 
Required Skills/Abilities: 

• Complete fluency in English, orally and written.
• Excellent diplomacy skills, for dealing with team and clients.
• Excellent organisational / project management skills and attention to detail
• Expert level proficiency in the use of social media marketing and the latest marketing technologies
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Strong supervisory and leadership skills.
• Ability to create, implement, and monitor budgets.
• Tech-native; proficient with multiple marketing and cloud platforms including Google Workspace, PPC management platforms, CRMs, Project Management tools etc.

Education and Experience:

• At least three years of hands-on digital marketing experience.
• Intimate knowledge of the PPC ecosystem, including the latest developments, challenges and opportunities.
• You have managed 6 or 7 figure monthly marketing spends.
• Ability to demonstrate previous high ROAS campaigns.

About the Role:

• 100% remote
• 100% flexitime
• Unlimited holiday
• Competitive package
• Supportive work culture, with team in 6 countries
• Free Oculus Quest 2 on signing :)

~

More about our values

We expect:
• Hard work, including some late nights and weekends (since we are running shows round the world);
• World-class standards.
• Attention to detail; we are moving fast and don't have time to be checking others' work.
• Humour (lots of humour).
• Respect and consideration for other team-members and our audience.
• Ethics - while we push the boundaries of the tech, we always act with honesty and integrity.
• Long-term, big picture thinking.
• A collaborative outlook and attitude.
• Ownership of mistakes, and the ability to turn them in to learning opportunities. We don't do guilt.
• Open, honest communication.

jobs.title: Performance Marketing Executive
jobs.description:
Vinterior is a startup that’s giving vintage a voice. In a world of mass-produced furniture, our marketplace helps the world shop more sustainably and champions independent vintage sellers. Sellers who we hand-pick for their expertise, and who share our obsession for craftsmanship and world-class customer service. In a world of sameness, take your place within an ambitious business, committed to helping the world shop more sustainably.

Vinterior launched in 2016 with 12 London dealers and 200 mid-century furniture pieces. In five years, we have grown to a community of 1,800 vintage sellers across Europe, generating over $600 million in sales worldwide. Two hundred thousand products across 97 furniture and homeware categories and 25 styles are now available on Vinterior, to the delight of our vintage fans.

After growing 120% in 2020, we have become the leading vintage marketplace in the UK. We have just raised a $10m series A to accelerate growth and expand to new markets in order to become the European leader by 2023. And as we are looking to the next stage of growth, we are seeking to recruit a Performance Marketing Executive (Paid Social, PCC)

We are seeking a talented and ambitious Performance Marketing Executive with experience of hands-on experience in Paid Google and Facebook ads, good numerical skills, a curious mindset, and positive attitude to help us drive 10x growth of our performance channel.

Working closely with the Performance Marketing Manager you will be helping to find new audiences, and entice them to our site through performance marketing best practices. From driving traffic to increasing engagement and conversions.

Key responsibilities

  • Manage the day to day of paid media campaigns including Paid Search, Shopping, Display, Discovery, and Paid Social).
  • Create, optimise and scale all paid media campaigns.
  • Implement our testing plan.

Retain is the world’s first Customer Insights Engine (CIE) that enables everyone responsible for delighting customers to be customer-obsessed. Overview:

The content marketing lead is responsible for generating compelling, high-quality content in a multitude of formats and channels – blog posts, eBooks, webinars, press releases, sales enablement docs, customer success guides, social media posts, etc. – for our enterprise prospects and customers. You'll lead the development and execution of a holistic content strategy to improve our thought leadership, business results, and presence in the market.  You'll partner with senior executives and public relations to craft executive communications and thought leadership.  You'll work with marketing and other cross-functional colleagues, including growth, sales, and product, to ensure we are telling the right stories in the right formats across paid, owned, and earned campaigns throughout the buyer's journey.

 

This is a unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup, build our content library, and create an integrated purpose-built content strategy playbook. This role will report to the Head of Marketing.

Requirements

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with company leadership, the sales team, and other areas in the company to brainstorm ideas for new content and come up with a content strategy.

  • Regularly create engaging content in the form of blog posts, eBooks, webinars, press releases, social media posts, etc.

  • Partner with customers and partners to create compelling case studies and testimonials.

  • Collaborate with the growth team to dovetail our content with our lead generation strategy and SEM/SEO initiatives.

Key Attributes:

  • Content creation machine. You must have the ability to brainstorm ideas with a wide variety of people - the sales team, product managers, customers, industry experts, etc - and quickly generate engaging content.

  • Communication. This role involves a lot of communication, both written and spoken, and excellent writing and speaking skills are therefore mandatory.

  • Experienced. You must have prior experience with content creation in the retail and/or technology industries.

  • Organized. You must have the ability to coordinate across teams to deliver quality content on a timely basis across multiple channels – excellent organizational skills are a must.

  • Collaborative. You must have the ability to collaborate with multiple internal and external stakeholders from a variety of backgrounds.


Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in content marketing or related disciplines at an enterprise SaaS company.

  • World-class writing and editing skills – and a love for creating all-things content.

  • A passion for innovative storytelling techniques, technologies, and programs.

  • Proven success mapping content to the enterprise buyer's journey.

  • The ability to guide content creation from ideation through execution.

  • A collaborative mindset that can partner with a wide range of teams including senior leadership, growth, product, and sales.


This is a great role for you, if:

  • You want to have a major impact on shaping the Retain brand and building our marquee customer portfolio.

  • You have demonstrated experience creating content for a “land and expand” B2B enterprise sales playbook.

  • You have the ability to hit the ground running and adapt quickly. We move fast and you should too.

  • You have an entrepreneurial mentality. Think company first, then team, then self.

Above all, our goal is to build a community of thoughtful team players who are enthusiastic about learning, sharing their expertise, and getting things done. If that resonates with you, we would love for you to apply.

jobs.title: Marketing Director
jobs.description:
Are you someone who loves a challenge, never settles for mediocrity, and is always competing with yourself to up-level your performance?

Do you spend all of your free time researching the latest digital marketing trends and following your favorite industry leaders to see what campaigns they’ll try next?

Do you have a passion for developing leaders and helping other marketers on your team develop their skillsets and reach their full potential?

Have you created transformational growth through lead generation and are excited to do the same thing, but this time for a company and product you're truly passionate about?

 

If so, then we have an exciting proposition for you…

 

If you're reading this, you’re interested in the Marketing Director position at Self Publishing School (or maybe you know someone who would be a fit). This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for the right person.

You’ll have a front row seat (and major responsibility / autonomy) at one of the fastest growing companies in America (INC 5,000 the last 3 years in a row - #1,944 in 2020).

You’ll be on the leadership team reporting directly to me, Chandler Bolt. (click here for bio, click here for LinkedIn).

You’ll also have a $1M+ per year marketing budget to spend and an awesome team to work with.

Your mission (should you choose to accept it): help us scale from $9.4M to $30M+/year over the next 2 years.

It’s a big job with a lot of responsibility. Keep reading if you have what it takes to get the job done...

POSITION SUMMARY

This position is responsible for driving the economic engine at Self-Publishing School. Simply put, the purpose of this position is to reduce CTAC (cost to acquire customer) while also growing Self Publishing School’s revenue as fast as possible.

This is done by managing the growth channels at SPS (see chapters 10 & 11 in Extreme Revenue Growth) and the leaders of those channels. There are 2 main ways to drive revenue:

  1. Filling up the sales team’s calendars with qualified appointments
  2. Generating “non rep revenue” via marketing funnels

When the job is done correctly, our most profitable marketing channels at SPS are growing quickly...with a high focus on doing more of what’s working...thus reducing Cost to Acquire a Customer (CTAC) and growing revenue.

It’s the role of the Marketing Director to focus the team on growing the channels that are working, prune the channels / campaigns that aren’t working, and breed a culture of testing/innovation to sprout new marketing campaigns and channels.

All of these decisions are made by data and rigorous testing...NOT… “gut feel”. Trusting your gut (informed by conversations with customers) is great when coming up with new tests to run...not when making big decisions on how to allocate marketing budget. :)

You MUST be:

  • A great leader ready to lead a team
  • Ready to learn, be challenged, and grow a ton
  • Scrappy, and eager to get your hands dirty...working in the trenches with your team
  • A systems thinker and numbers based decision maker
  • An execution-oriented, results-based operator
  • Passionate about digital marketing and rigorous testing in a competitive market


NOTE: This position is full-time and virtual. Meaning you can work from anywhere. The team here at SPS is located around the world, with the majority of us in North America. Preference for this position is someone working in the US or Canada.

DISQUALIFIERS: Please DO NOT apply to this position if you:

  • Have no interest in books (and using books to change people’s lives)
  • Aren’t willing to get your hands dirty / get in the weeds with marketing campaigns, implementation, etc.
  • Are intimidated by analytics, KPIs, and aggressive growth goals
  • Have zero experience leading a team

If none of these things can be said of you, then please continue reading...

 


ABOUT SELF-PUBLISHING SCHOOL:

Click here to check out a video from our CEO Chandler Bolt to find out what it’s like to work at Self Publishing School.

Self-Publishing School is an online education company that teaches people how to write, market & publish their first book in as little as 90 days.

We provide people with more opportunities, confidence & income through publishing a book.

Our program is by far the best on the market which is why we have one of the highest student success rates of any online training company. We genuinely care about the success of our students and provide a great avenue for them to be successful.

Our company is driven by 2 unique viewpoints:

  • It’s not about the book. It’s about what the book does for you. We believe that “Books Change Lives” and we believe in the power of “Leveraged Impact” (changing lives through books)
  • In going through the process, our students learn a lot about themselves and conquer fears, challenges & limiting beliefs they never knew existed.

They’re also surprised by all of the opportunities that pop up once their book is out in the world.

The purpose of our company is to disrupt the publishing industry and show people that self publishing is not only an option, it’s the BEST option.

The publishing industry is broken. Big publishers are antiquated and inefficient. They take advantage of the people doing the hard work...the authors. Our company exists to show people there is a better way…

…a way that doesn’t involve: using a publisher, wasting 2 years of your life, giving away all of your creative liberties, giving away all of your book royalties, and relying on a publisher that doesn’t do any marketing for your book.

Click here to check out the “explainer video” of what we do at Self Publishing School.

Click here to watch the TEDx talk from our founder (Chandler Bolt) and learn more about the WHY behind what we do.


Self Publishing School made the INC 5000 in 2018 (#2,699), in 2019 (#1,483), and in 2020 (#1,944) as one of the 5,000 fastest-growing private companies in the US.

As we always say, “the best is yet to come”. We’re excited to continue climbing & growing thanks to our incredible team & customers.


About the team:

There’s currently 36 full-time, and several part-time team members at Self Publishing School working remotely from across the country and around the world.

All team members are “A players”, with a love and passion and a drive to do great work and make the world a better place.

You won’t find grumbling, negative co-workers here. People at SPS are passionate and excited about what they do!


About the culture:

Here are the company core values. We call it “The SPS Way”:

  1. Honesty & Integrity Always Win
  2. Fail Fast, Fail Forward, Fail Often
  3. Hard Work & Continuous Improvement
  4. Everyone is Responsible for Facilitating Change
  5. Best Is The Standard

Click here to watch a video from our founder Chandler Bolt explaining the company Core Values.


Although the team is virtual at SPS, the culture is alive and well...often referenced as one of employee's favorite parts about working here.

2 times a year the entire team meets in a unique city in the US (sometimes internationally) for a 3-5 day company retreat...planning the next quarter, connecting in person, having fun, and celebrating wins. As a member of the executive team, you can plan on traveling a minimum of 4 times a year for 3-7 days per trip for quarterly strategic planning with the executive team.

The environment is very fast paced, and high growth. The company is growing fast, meaning a high level of accountability, responsibility and autonomy for everyone on the team.

We’re constantly investing in the training & growth of our team members through book clubs, courses, trainings, and live seminars. All employees are given $15,000+ worth of training and continued education upon being hired with the company.

Since you’re working remotely, you can say goodbye to the dreaded commute (meaning more time for family & fun). This isn’t your average 9-5. Hours are somewhat flexible as long as you get your work done. That being said, due to the growth & pace of the company, it’s not uncommon to work 45-50+ hour weeks.

Because of the company’s growth & hiring needs, there’s a huge opportunity for advancement and promotion if you’re a fast learner.

Overall, the culture of the company is high growth, fun, empowering, and motivating, with support from a world-class team of people who love what they do.

In 2019, Self Publishing School was certified as a “Great Place To Work” by GreatPlaceToWork.com.

Click here to watch a video from our CEO (Chandler Bolt) on how we build GREAT culture on our virtual team at SPS.

jobs.title: B2B Marketing Manager USA
jobs.description:
The Company and Mission:

Wagestream is the global leader in Financial Wellbeing. We provide an income streaming solution for employers to give employees instant access to their earnings, and prevent them ever having to go into debt between pay cycles.

Our mission is to provide fair financial services to all and our technology has started to create a whole new category; the workplace bank.

We were founded for a social purpose to reduce the poverty premium. We believe the pay cycle is fundamentally broken and unfair to employees, and that we can fix it. We know financial services are better served through the employer, and have built a set of tools [track, stream, save, learn], that boost the financial resilience of a workforce and have a measurable and proven impact on employee retention and productivity.

We love our clients and do everything we can to support them. We already help 750,000 employees worldwide access their income when they need it, across some of the largest organizations in the UK, Spain, Australia and USA including Fortune 500 companies in retail, hospitality and healthcare.

The Opportunity:

Wagestream USA was launched in 2020 and, since then, has seen phenomenal success. We’re now looking to hire our first member of the US Marketing team to help further our growth - the sky really is the limit and we need someone who can help us get there! We’re looking for someone who is happy (and comfortable) to be initially very hands-on with a view to growing a team in the not too distant future. You’ll be working closely with the GM to establish and optimize our marketing strategy: it’s a new market and proposition to US Employers so represents the ultimate challenge for a creative and motivated B2B marketeer. This is an opportunity to have a huge impact, working alongside a team who are incredibly passionate about the mission and its potential.

The Team:

We’re looking for someone who thrives in a highly collaborative and fast-paced environment. We’re a small but rapidly growing team in the US that works closely together within sales, marketing, customer support, customer success and engineering teams. You’ll also have the support of the Wagestream Global Marketing team. We’re looking for someone who’s naturally resourceful, tenacious and willing to get stuck in!

Requirements

What will you be doing?

As the first marketeer in the US you’ll have a mix of strategic AND tactical responsibilities. From writing web copy, to mastering the CRM and doing customer interviews. You will own the marketing strategy for the US and will be delivering on it too!

Some of the responsibilities (but not limited to):

  • Telling the US who we are and why we exist - in a way that makes them sit up and listen
  • Developing the country wide strategy for social media, emails, video, PR, blogs and events
  • Own and drive demand through all digital channels platforms (inhouse and/or agency)
  • Building campaigns that generate new business, working alongside content and design to create ads and landing pages
  • Reporting on performance of campaigns
  • Ensuring our messaging is strong and consistent across all channels
  • Identifying and iterating on repeatable marketing strategies, tactics and channels that address business pain points and convey product benefits to drive new customer acquisition
  • Optimizing programs using metrics and data, such as lead volume and conversion, program pipeline, velocity in funnel metrics, opportunity conversion
  • Work alongside the GM and sales team in developing collateral and sales enablement content

What experience might you have?

  • Experience in multiple B2B marketing disciplines across, PR, Events, Lead Generation, Channel Marketing and Brand Building
  • Experience doing campaign analysis with optimization, as well as creating or editing reporting dashboards for digital marketing performance
  • The experience of, and understanding that, marketing is the intersection of creativity and business
  • Robust project management skills - there will be a lot to do and someone who can manage workload and stakeholders is a must
  • Know what constitutes great content

Within 1 month you’ll have:

  • Developed our market positioning; how are we different from our competition
  • Developed a marketing strategy for our US based business
  • Started demand generating activities like LinkedIn Posts
  • Developed a working relationship with your UK counterparts

Within 3 months you’ll have:

  • Directly contributing to the growth of our US business
  • Reaching the right people at the right time!
  • Begin hiring people to further round out the Marketing organization

Within 6 months you’ll have:

  • A full marketing team working around you.
  • Large corporations, platforms, HCM and Payroll companies know Wagestream.
  • Differentiated Wagestream in the US Market.

 

Salary - $100,000 - $120,000

Benefits

We truly believe we have a great benefits offering here in the Wagestream team, & we have tried to highlight everything here - if there is something you think we need to add - let us know!

  • We will pay you what you're worth. We are fully committed to closing the gender pay gap, promoting diversity and inclusivity, and paying people what they deserve to be paid.
  • We're a Remote First business - work from home or our Saratoga (NY) office - you choose! We have team members across the East Coast time zone, from Michigan to New York City to Texas - we place an emphasis on finding the right people in any location, not any people in the right location.
  • We will help you manage your busy lifestyle with flexible working opportunities, most of the team work "core hours" to allow touchpoints with your team, but we also make sure you have the time to pick the kids up at 3pm, or go for that mid-morning run to boost your productivity. We want you to have the best of both worlds.
  • We offer 15 days annual leave in addition to national holidays, as well as flexible time off allowances for any ad-hoc childcare/family/caring needs, and 5 days fully paid sick leave.
  • All our USA employees are eligible to join our Private Healthcare Scheme with Aetna.
  • We will support you with your career endeavours. We are committed to internal progression, and offering our team members the best opportunities for growth. We want to invest in you the same way you're going to invest in us!
  • We want everyone to achieve "zen mastery" with a free subscription to Calm — work can be stressful (we know!) and we want to help you switch off
  • And the best benefit of all... Free access to Wagestream service - naturally!

jobs.title: Technical Content Writer
jobs.description:
Are you an experienced WordPress user, very familiar with plugins, themes and hosting?
Are you interested in understanding technical aspects behind WordPress products?

 

Do you love writing engaging content? Are you able to explain complex topics in simple words?

 

If you answered yes to these questions, we are sure this position will sound super exciting to you. 🤩

 

We are looking for a friendly person who loves to write, to produce high-quality content for WP Rocket, Imagify, and RocketCDN. 🚀

 

Keep reading for more details! 📝

 

Become Our Technical Content Writer!

 

In your job as a Technical Content Writer, you will write and manage technical content that builds credibility and authority for the company.

 

In this role, you will report directly to the Content Marketer and you will contribute significantly in providing great content that educates our audience and leads to more business. For this position it’s essential to be perfectly fluent in English and to have advanced technical knowledge (web performance and/or WordPress development).

 

You will join our marketing team, which is based in Europe. We work remotely, and ideally you should live in a country that aligns with the European Timezone.
We are so curious to know which new country will be added to our distributed team map! 🌍

 

What You Will Be Doing:

In your everyday job as a Technical Content Writer, you will conduct research, lead speed tests, write new content and update existing one. You should be comfortable with technical content!


Here is a list describing the tasks involved in this position (do you happen to like making lists? So do we!):

 

  • You will work with product, engineering and support teams to obtain an in-depth understanding of our products.
  • You will conduct research on industry-related topics and need to stay up-to-date with the latest trends.
  • You will write engaging, easy-to understand and accurate content (blog posts, ebooks, guides…) addressing SEO requirements.
  • You will submit your work to our Content Marketer for input and approval and publish your content following the editorial calendar.
  • You will make edits to existing content in an effort to improve readability, SEO, accuracy, and keep the content up-to-date overall.

 

What Do You Need To Excel at This Job:

✍️ Please share samples of your work or portfolio of your published articles with your application.

 

Proven working experience in writing and editing.

You have a solid experience in creating well-structured content, in a conversational tone to guide beginners and more advanced WordPress users. You understand the importance of SEO and how to address it through your content writing.

 

Advanced technical knowledge and understanding of WordPress.

You have a working knowledge of technologies used in modern WordPress development and of PHP, JavaScript, HTML and CSS. You can set up a local website to test out products and services. You are familiar with the various types of plugins, themes and services.

 

Web performance knowledge.

You have experience with web performance optimization. You know how to measure page load speeds. You understand caching. Terms like gzip, preload, minify, and lazyload are not foreign to you. You know the difference between PageSpeed score and page load time.

 

Fluency in English.

You will need to be able to effectively write and communicate in English, respectfully, and professionally. You can proofread your work.

 

Do you want to know two other things we appreciate about our candidates?

 

  • Previous remote job experience.
    Slack will be your virtual office, where all the life of the company takes place.
  • The involvement in the WordPress community.
    We support our teammates to attend and/or speak at WordCamps and volunteer within the community.
 
What You Should Know About Our Company: WP Media

Founded in 2014 in the beautiful Lyon, France, WP Media is an equal opportunity employer with a distributed team of +35 teammates living around the world.

 

 

We are best known as the creators of WP Rocket, but we also developed Imagify.

Imagify is the free image optimization service, including a free WordPress plugin: we have already optimized more than 2,000,000,000 images! 😲

 

Do We Share the Same Values?

Mutual respect, collaboration, and inclusivity.

These are the fundamental values that support our life as a team.

 

Healthy balance between work and private life.

We encourage our employees to enjoy their family and hobbies with flexible working hours and minimum vacation policy (you should take a minimum of 5 weeks per year: really, we don’t count them!).

 

 

We care about the work you do, not about the hours you sit at your desk.

You can organize your working day with flexible working hours. There are no time cards to stamp, only customers to make happy and friendly teammates to work with!

 

Transparent culture.

We have a public salary grid. Once a year, when the company does well, we share our profits with the team in the form of bonuses.

 

We like to see each other in person whenever possible.

Every year, we organize a trip with the whole team and spend a week of coworking and fun activities together.


To give you an idea, so far we have traveled to Spain, Portugal, and Mexico:

 

 

Now that we've told you so much about us, it's your turn.

 

Let us know why you would like to become our Technical Content Writer and why you think you are the person we are looking for.

 

We can’t wait to receive your application! 🌟

jobs.title: Director - Product Marketing
jobs.description:
The Company

At Bigeye, our mission is to help our customers make magic with data.

We built some of the most widely adopted tools at companies like Uber and saw how fast teams move when they have a great data toolchain. Now, Bigeye is building best-of-breed tools for analysts, data scientists, and data engineers on data teams everywhere. 

At Bigeye, we are re-envisioning data quality with the leading data observability platform. In less than 15 minutes, customers instrument data sources with thousands of data quality metrics and anomaly detection algorithms that proactively alert them to issues. With Bigeye, data teams prevent customer-facing data outages, save expensive engineering hours, and build greater trust in the data.

We’re growing quickly: In less than 18 months since founding, Bigeye has raised $66M in funding from leading investors like Sequoia, Coatue, and Costanoa. In that time, Bigeye has built a customer base of data teams from organizations like Instacart, Udacity, and Clubhouse, and more than doubled the size of the team.

 

The Work

Bigeye is looking for an experienced product marketer to build and lead our product marketing team from the ground up. The Director of Product Marketing will report to the co-founder and CEO, and will drive the strategy for Bigeye’s positioning, messaging, content strategy, and GTM team enablement.

This role will have an outsized impact on our growth trajectory, and will work with company leadership, product management, and sales to bring our platform to new customers and increase our adoption with existing customers.

 

What you’ll be doing

  • Developing and maintaining a deep knowledge of our product and how it matches our customer needs.

  • Creating differentiated positioning and messaging that resonates with our customers and drives our leadership in the market.

  • Ensuring our messaging is clear and consistent across sales and marketing.

  • Building and owning core marketing and sales collateral.

  • Create packaging and pricing that helps Bigeye capture target use cases and customer segments. 

  • Developing and maintaining relationships with customers to continuously learn about their use of Bigeye, incorporating it into our product and go to market strategies.

  • Understanding the competitive landscape and keeping our go to marketing strategy cutting edge.

  • Partnering with Sales leadership to design and execute effective sales enablement programs  

  • Partnering with Product Management, Marketing and Sales to design and execute effective product launch campaigns.

  • Partnering with Demand Generation and Content teammates to design and execute integrated marketing campaigns that drive demand for our platform.

 

What you bring

  • 5+ years of experience marketing technical B2B products. 

  • Experience building content, brand and sales enablement plans and orchestrating the execution of it.

  • Experience developing a positioning and messaging framework that resonated with your customers.

  • Crisp and concise communication. Background in design and copywriting is a plus.

  • Experience partnering with a sales team.

  • Ability to define and track quantitative measures of marketing performance.

  • Ability to develop your own frameworks and systems from first principles.

  • Experience working across functions like design, engineering, marketing, and sales.

 

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience understanding, connecting with, and marketing to a data engineering, data science, or data analyst audience.

  • Experience managing outside agencies and contractors.

  • Working knowledge of web frontend technologies and frameworks.

 

Benefits

  • Highly competitive salary and equity opportunity

  • Remote first - Live where you want in the US

  • Medical, Dental and Vision to keep you healthy

  • 401k plan to help you save for the future

  • Generous PTO to have fun

  • Receive an elite technology package to make work easier

  • Stipend to make your home office more comfortable

 

Bigeye is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we will not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any sort. We do celebrate diversity and believe experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Diversity in our team makes for better problem solving, more creative thinking, and ultimately a better product and company culture.

Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of impact, dedication, and the ability to thrive in a fast paced and collaborative environment. Bigeye strives to have an inclusive work environment; so if you are hard working & good at what you do then please come as you are.  We want you to contribute, grow, & learn at Bigeye and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for.

jobs.title: User Acquisition
jobs.description:
Air Apps' team is hiring highly motivated teammates to help build, maintain and market our mobile applications. We are a 100% remote company with just over 18 employees working across the globe every single day to build products that enrich people's lives. We combine the simplicity and greatness of Apple products by creating utility and productivity apps that make people's lives easier. Our portfolio contains Translate Now & Calculator Air, both the fastest-growing apps in their category. Our apps have been downloaded over 50 million times and received over 2 million ratings with an average of 4.6 stars.

Mission

At Air Apps, we intend to make people's life easier by offering software solutions that allow people to perform their daily activities in work, social, fitness, and learning right from their mobile devices.

About the role

We are looking for a Mobile Marketing Specialist who will manage key paid user acquisition channels to build and execute strategies that drive scalable and sustainable growth for multiple apps globally. You will be part of a marketing organization that drives Air Apps' user growth. You'll be able to immediately see the impact of your work and advance our mission of making people's life easier.

Responsibilities
  • Manage key paid user acquisition channels while targeting performance ROAS/KPI goals.
  • Manage your channels end to end, including developing channel strategy, defining targeting, managing creatives, setting up campaigns, optimizing campaigns, measuring performance, and driving insights to inform future campaigns.
  • Use a data-driven approach & a vigorous testing process to evaluate hypotheses and extract insights on strategy and performance.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the customer experience and data flow from acquisition and engagement to drive conversions & revenues.
  • Create a robust reporting and monitoring system to distill performance to managers regularly.
  • Work closely with data, product, and ASO teams to implement marketing systems and tools while identifying opportunities to enhance the customer experience and drive additional conversions and revenue.
  • Collaborate with third-party content creators, including the creative team, to help create new and innovative messaging and customer touchpoints.
Expected daily activities
  • Manage Apple Search Ads and Google Ads worldwide.
  • Track, optimize, and measure campaign performance daily.
  • Optimize campaigns and analyze results to help us determine how and where our budget should be allocated.
  • Discover new keywords and market opportunities on AS daily.
  • Manage day-to-day communication with crucial marketing partners (e.g., resolve issues, document challenges, create roadmaps, facilitate collaborative brainstorming sessions, etc.).
  • Compile weekly, monthly, and quarterly reports to turn performance marketing data into meaningful insights and take relevant action on insights gained.
  • Conduct research to monitor and study the competition, including SOV and ranking across App Stores.
  • Collaborate with the ASO responsible for developing app store assets with updated features while incorporating findings from ASO and paid campaigns.
  • Work with the in-house creative team to produce high-performing creative.
  • Collaborate with the product team to spot and analyze opportunities for scalability and growth.
  • Partner closely with our backend team to improve our internal business intelligence system.
Your opportunity

We offer a fully remote, results-driven work style that enhances productivity and quality, providing excellent work-life balance. We also have great opportunities to connect within our international team through coffee calls, team meetings, and hackathons.

  • Proven startup with significant ambitions
  • Highly competitive salary and bonuses
  • Flexible work environment, 100% remote
  • Apple hardware environment
  • USD100.00 Monthly allowance (Home office, Learning, Wellness)
  • USD350.00 Home office set up
  • Retreats - We plan to hold a yearly get together (COVID19 - when safe again)
Statutory benefits
  • Health insurance (or your country's standard)
  • 24 Annual vacation days (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks sick leave (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks parental leave (or your country's standard)
  • National holidays (or your country's standard)
  • 40 Hours work-week (or your country's standard)
  • Plus any other statutory benefit in your country

 

You are passionate about building world-class software. You aspire to join an energetic team in a fast-growing startup to develop and grow products at scale. Your desired skills and experience include:

  • Proficient in English
  • 3 years of professional experience in mobile marketing
  • At least 2 years of hands-on experience running ASA and UAC campaigns to hit efficiency & volume targets
  • Experience using third party mobile attribution tools such as Appsflyer, Adjust, or Kochava to drive effective campaign optimization strategies
  • Ability to work on global campaigns and understand the importance of localization on performance and user behavior in mobile-first markets
  • Deep knowledge of modern analytics, reporting, and business intelligence tools. Including data visualization tools
  • Analytical skills and experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent knowledge of marketing landscape and roadmap to deliver improved efficiency and growth
  • Self-starting, self-motivated, self-directed, and self-sufficient
  • Be up to date with the latest mobile marketing trends, features, and requirements.
  • BS in Marketing or equivalent industry experience
Teamwork

The job requires operating in small teams in a highly dynamic and remote environment. Working remotely means that you need to, at least, manage one person - yourself. You must be able to, including but not limited to:

  • Work effectively with multi-functional and international teams
  • Work highly collaborative, without any micro-management necessary
  • Use Slack and other remote communication/reporting tools
  • Implement and structure a remote working routine
  • Discipline and manage yourself
  • Communicate heavily about statuses and issues
  • Combine work and life in a healthy and productive flow
  • Juggle multiple projects at the same time
  • Work agile and fast, very fast
  • Receive and provide constructive feedback
  • Embrace changes
  • Find the needle in the haystack and solve problems methodically
What Happens Next?

We expect to review your application ASAP. You'll hear from us within 2-3 days if we decide to invite you to a technical exercise. The exercise is representative of the kind of day-to-day work you'd be doing on the team. We usually only invite candidates to this stage that meet minimum standards, and those candidates should expect to spend about 2-3 hours completing this test.

The next phase of the hiring process will be a video interview with our people operations manager (approx. 30 min). You and she will talk through your background and your approach to remote, teamwork and Air Apps. After the people interview, the top candidates will proceed to the team interview stage. You'll talk with 1-2 members of the team about your technical knowledge, experience and discuss the position (approx. 1h).

The top candidates will proceed to the final interview stage. You'll talk to the leadership team and will align yours and the company's expectations. We aim to make an offer 3-5 days after your final interview.

Please note that we're unable to offer individual feedback during the process. We usually see 1,000+ applications, and our team can't provide personalized feedback. It is a demanding application process. We appreciate you giving us that consideration, and we promise to provide you with our full attention in return.

Disclaimer

This position is fully REMOTE; no re-allocation or visa sponsorship is provided. You will work from anywhere; however, you will be hired in your legal country of residency.

jobs.title: Field Marketing Manager

jobs.title: VP Marketing
jobs.description:
Striim is seeking a VP of Marketing to lead all marketing activity for the business - including demand generation, branding, thought leadership, account based marketing, and product marketing. This is a critical hire, and the role will report directly to the Chief Revenue Officer. Beyond the core tactical elements of the job, the ideal candidate is encouraged to contribute strategically to the overall direction of the company’s growth.

What You'll Do

jobs.title: Head of Content
jobs.description:
Based in the UK, but with one of our major markets being the US, we're looking for an International Head of Content


Glorify began its journey in 2019, with a hard-launch in November 2020, and has quickly grown to become the leading Christian Daily Worship app in the world. With successful launches in the US, Brazil and LATAM, around 2 million downloads and 1 million + Active Users, Glorify is on its way to becoming the world’s largest digital platform for the 2.5 billion Christians worldwide. Think Calm or Headspace but for the Christian community.


Glorify utilises bite-size readings, meditations, music and gamification techniques, to enable people to spend daily time with God through guided worship routines, curated content and a world-class user experience. Strong relationships with influencers in this space has helped drive this growth, and now translating into more languages will further that growth globally.


Having recently secured our Series A round from Tier 1 VC’s, we are now looking to significantly scale up our team, product development and marketing activity. Do you want to be part of our next stage of growth, as we expand around the world?


Reporting to the Creative Director you will own the content strategy for all categories within the Glorify app, in all territories globally.


You will lead the content creation process, working with an internal team and a range of external freelance talent, from designers to theologists, psychologists, producers and narrators. You will lead ideation sessions, define the briefs and work with the team to execute.


You will work hand-in-hand with the Product and Marketing teams to glean insights from engagement metrics, content placement variances, distribution platform performance, SEO trends and marketplace information, to inform both your new content programming and your User engagement improvements.


Working with the Product Design team, you will be responsible for content placement and layout within the app. With Personalization becoming a major feature of the User experience, you will apply data-driven decisions on programming, placement and algorithms for individual content feeds.


We are a global business and we are seeing huge growth in Latin American Christian communities, so you will need to build an understanding of local markets and global trends quickly. In addition you will work closely with our Marketing teams, to ensure that our content is leveraged in the most effective way to drive User acquisition and growth.

Requirements

You should be an expert in creating digital content, ideally working as a Head of Content in your current role. You must have been responsible for creating and executing a content strategy for a consumer app or tech platform, including content placement within the user environment. You must have a thorough understanding of the creative process for video and audio based content and have strong creative abilities yourself.


Using data effectively is really important in this role so we will want to hear about a time when you had to adjust your strategy in response to data insights during execution, or added new, successful content categories as result of consumer-driven data.


You will own this function of the business so it’s really important you can create or optimise processes around content creation. We’ll want to hear about a time when your improvements really impacted the efficiency of your team.


Ideally you will have previous experience in producing content for Christian communities, but if not you should have some strong examples of times when you have delivered a content strategy for users that you were unfamiliar with.


Finally Spanish or Portuguese would be very useful in this role, but are not a prerequisite so long as you have been responsible for content production in non-native languages or with unfamiliar communities.

Benefits

Why Glorify?

We are ambitious, skilled and growing fast! Within our environment, this role has lots of responsibilities and a huge remit to make things happen.


You will be able to grow your team and ultimately build the whole department, with a mixture of in-house team and freelancers.


While a UK based candidate would be ideal, we offer flexible working and can accommodate overseas remote working options. Most staff are in the office three days a week, in a slightly edgy office space at The Handbag Factory in Vauxhall, that includes a gym and several other amenities.


Equipment - MacBook Pro or a Windows machine if you prefer.

Holiday - 25 days + Bank Holidays.

Staff socials - Tuesday lunches, Friday breakfasts, Monthly drinks, Summer and Christmas parties.

Share Options - We want everyone to feel a part of the journey.

Pension scheme.

jobs.title: Growth Marketing Strategist
jobs.description:
Sona Labs provides a customer data platform and tech-enabled managed services for growth marketing. With our managed services offerings, we specialize in paid search, paid social, conversion rate optimization, and managed reporting for growth. Through years of experience with high-scale growth marketing, our team has continually encountered a range of data challenges related to bringing together marketing, sales, finance, and advertising data distributed across silos, combining this distributed data to build key customer insights, and bringing this unified and enhanced customer data into the many systems where it can be leveraged.

For growth marketers, we set out to build a single source of truth for customer data that could be utilized for campaign analysis and optimization, internal systems (sales, marketing, finance, etc), and for growth marketing activities carried out by external systems. With the most accurate and trustworthy customer data, growth marketers can make better informed decisions and they can accomplish more streamlined growth operations. Additionally, our customer data platform serves as the backbone for our managed services offerings. Growth operational activities such as campaign generation, ad creative analysis and optimization, lifecycle marketing activities, and more are able to access technologies which reduce manual processes and improve growth ROI.

As part of our growth marketing managed services team, you'll be the primary point of contact and instrumental in helping to achieve the client's marketing goals. This role involves building and maintaining client relationships, defining client media strategies, identifying client KPI's, overseeing the integration of the S/L Growth Platform to measure client KPI's, implementing reports and working with the S/L Growth Platform to optimize large-scale digital marketing campaigns.

SUMMARY

Sona Labs is seeking a growth marketing strategist. This individual will be responsible for maintaining the client relationship as the primary point of contact, running regular client meetings and reporting, and driving KPI improvements through developing cutting-edge strategies tailored to client goals. This role will manage a portfolio of clients, ranging from $50k-$500k/month in ad spend. Core responsibilities include strategy development, tactical execution, and management of client relationships.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze client marketing initiatives through data analysis on the S/L Platform
  • Define, monitor and analyze trends in clients’ KPIs
  • Develop paid search/social strategy based on client-specific goals
  • Identify gaps and opportunities to improve efficiencies, acquisition and conversion performance
  • Implement reports on the S/L platform for regular client reporting and ad-hoc analyses
  • Build and optimize Google, Bing, and Facebook campaigns for a roster of clients across search, social, display, and YouTube
  • Using programmatic approaches enabled by the S/L Growth Platform, test and analyze targeting criteria (keywords & audiences), ad creatives, landing pages and bid strategies to drive results in line with clients’ goals
  • Communicate performance results and strategy recommendations to clients & secure buy-in from decision makers
  • Design and oversee the implementation of the growth marketing lifecycle including integrations with external systems

Requirements

  • Strong analytical skills including experience defining and using metrics (e.g., LTV, CAC, etc.) and performing data analysis to identify trends and measure impact
  • Strong interpersonal skills and are able to work cross-functionally with leaders on Product, Marketing, Engineering teams.
  • Able to work independently as well as in a collaborative team setting, with strong problem solving and time-management skills
  • 5+ years of analytical experience; advanced data analysis skills, preferably within marketing
  • Proficient in Excel and experience working with SQL
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Undergraduate degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience

jobs.title: Sr. Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
About Levro

Levro is building a new global bank.

Our cornerstone product is a a multicurrency business neobank that allows companies to collect, hold, and pay in 34 currencies within a single interface. We help software and ecommerce companies make international payments as easy as domestic payments, minimizing fees, redtape, and errors .

We are 2x YCombinator batchmates who have experience in regulated financial spaces and expertise with deep enterprise integrations. Abeer built a $1.5B machine learning enabled hedgefund with LPs like MIT and GIC, and Cathy built a profitable big data company that processed $4B of retail data.

We’re looking for the core team that will build Levro into the operating system for international commerce.

What we’re hiring for:

We are building a marketing team from scratch, and are looking for an entrepreneurial, data-driven, cross functional marketer to lead that charge.

We want someone willing to take reasonable risks to define the marketing strategy, and work cross-functionally to execute it

Our ideal candidate is a "full stack" marketer - someone as comfortable writing content and designing collateral as they are setting up and managing customer acquisition campaigns.

What You’ll do:
  • Define and execute Levro's go-to-market messaging - from setting the strategy to writing for our blog, authoring ebooks, make videos, and manage our social media
  • Set up and manage our marketing automation strategy and pair it with an equally strong content marketing approach
  • Serve as the voice of the customer in discussions with product and engineering to help triage feature priorities
  • Wear a "growth hacker" hat - figure out the best ways to attract and retain our target audience
  • Own the top of our funnel - making sure we generate sufficient marketing qualified leads through a combination of prospecting and other lead generation activities
  • Build a team of internal and external specialists to help with scaling our brand
What we’re looking for:
  • 3-4 years experience in various aspects of marketing - content marketing, social media, paid acquisition
  • Entrepreneurial, with high tolerance for ambiguity and complexity, and efficient with limited resources.
  • Experience working at, or with startups - most of our initial customers will be startups
  • Strong ability to conduct and compile research into how-to guides and eBooks - distilling complex processes and concepts into simple checklists for our clients to better understand the nuances of international banking
  • Proven ability to track, prioritize, and steer multiple concurrent projects to success using data to track progress along the way
  • Action oriented with excellent work ethic and initiative
  • Location: San Francisco office or Remote
What makes this job amazing:
  • As an early employee, you will get exposure to the nuances of venture-backed companies. From fundraising and investor conversations to product and customers, we will share what we know so that you can eventually start your own company
  • Your work will matter - you will get to shape the product foundations and build the culture that’ll be at Levro’s core
  • Levro's goal is to become the best global business bank, you will play a part of that
  • You'll have an opportunity to grow with Levro - as we scale, you will have an opportunity to define the ideal professional path for you, and bring along smart people to complement you
  • The team is amazing, you'll learn and grow alongside some of the most talented people in the industry!
  • Every day is a new challenge.
Founders

Levro was founded by 2x YC batchmates who have experience in regulated financial spaces and expertise with deep enterprise integrations. We understand the unique needs of international business banking and are building a new way for payments to flow around the global economy.

🇨🇦 Cathy was previously CEO of 42 Technologies (YC W14), a big data platform processing over $4B of data for global retailers including AllSaints, Rebecca Minkoff, and Sports Direct. She closed 42's first $1MM ARR and led enterprise sales, finance, strategy, and operations.

[Education: Harvard Business School]

🇮🇳 Abeer was previously CTO of Theorem LP (YC W14), a data science and machine learning platform that bought marketplace loans with over $1.5B AUM (from MIT Endowment, GIC, etc.). He led the research and engineering teams and wrote the algorithms Theorem used to buy over $2B+ worth of loans.

[Education: Carnegie Mellon University]

jobs.title: Corrections Engagement Director
jobs.description:
Ameelio has quickly established itself as the future of prison communication and virtual learning. We were recently chosen as Fast Company's World-Changing Idea in Social Justice. 

As we scale, we're looking for an experienced full-time hire to join our small and nimble team. As the Corrections Engagement Director, you'd help source opportunities, guide our contracting process, and manage relationships with the corrections agencies at the local, state, and national levels. The ideal applicant is experienced in the RFP/RFI process (either as a government or public-sector vendor employee), is familiar with corrections, and would be able to use their knowledge and personal relationships to bring a deep understanding of the Department of Corrections' procurement and contracting culture. Ultimately, you'll support Ameelio's bidding process on our way to becoming the nation's first free full-contracting prison communications platform.

What we're looking for:

  • Between 3-5 years of professional experience in a related role/environment.
  • Responsibilities include: 
    • Making warm introductions, and coordinating meetings with officials at various levels of corrections agencies.
    • Communicate and present information effectively; assess DOC needs and negotiate partnerships by state. 
    • Identify opportunities for partnership across different agencies. 
    • Reviewing and approving contract terms, monitoring upcoming bids and deadlines, execute contracts as efficiently as possible. 
    • Work closely with Program Directors to create and maintain positive working relationships with DOCs and facilities, and ensure needs and expectations are met. 
    • Ensure Ameelio's internal contract documents are accurate and well maintained. 

Why you'll love us:

  • A welcoming and collaborative environment with people who are. dedicating their lives to fighting the commercialization of incarceration
  • Experience working closely with users who rely on our products to stay in touch with their loved ones.
  • An environment for rapid experimentation and ownership.
  • Ownership of systems and features that deliver society-changing impact.
  • Contributing to the foundation and culture of a young and growing organization.
  • Experience working cross-functionally and exposure to a variety of business functions.
  • An incredibly high bar for the quality of your work.
  • Flexible and remote working environment
  • Compensation: $60,000 - $80,000

About Ameelio

Ameelio is a nonprofit technology company that builds free technology to accelerate the creation of a more humane and rehabilitative justice system. We were recently chosen as one of Fast Company's 2021 World Changing Ideas. Our tools will enable 27 million Americans to communicate with their incarcerated loved ones for free, organizations to scale their social services, and educators to empower incarcerated people through virtual learning. We are a technological bridge that reconnects incarcerated people with their families and vital resources — for free. Our tools will help improve post-release outcomes, lower recidivism rates, and help America safely reduce the size of its prison populations.

We're backed by Schmidt Futures, Mozilla Foundation, the Robin Hood Foundation, Google.org, and Fast Forward accelerator. Our funders also include Eric Schmidt, the former Google CEO, Jack Dorsey, the CEO of Twitter and Square, and Vinod Khosla, co-founder of Sun Microsystems and the founder of Khosla Ventures. Our work has been covered by Forbes, TechCrunch, Fast Company, The Washington Post, Business Insider, and others.

Company History

Ameelio was an all-volunteer effort until late-2020. Since, we've built an A-team that brings together technical and criminal justice expertise, participated in Mozilla's Spring MVP Lab (won 1st place), Fast Forward Accelerator, Robin Hood BRL program, and Visible Connect's Accelerator. We're backed by Schmidt Futures, Mozilla Foundation, the Robin Hood Foundation, Google.org, and Fast Forward accelerator. Our funders also include Eric Schmidt, the former Google CEO, Jack Dorsey, the CEO of Twitter and Square, and Vinod Khosla, co-founder of Sun Microsystems and the founder of Khosla Ventures.

  • Website: www.ameelio.org
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/teamameelio

External References:

  • Bloomberg: Nonprofit aims to disrupt pricey prison telecom industry
  • Fast Company: This app is making it free for incarcerated people to make video calls
  • Forbes: The Prison Communications Nonprofit Backed By Twitter's Jack Dorsey And Former Google Chief Eric Schmidt
  • Washington Post: Let inmates talk to their families for free
  • Tech Crunch: Ameelio wants to take on for-profit, prison-calling rackets after starting with free letters to inmates
  • Fast Company: This app bypasses the absurdly high cost of making phone calls to prison by converting texts to snail mail

Problem We're Solving

The $1.4 billion prison communications industry generates obscene profits by charging extortionate prices to the incarcerated and their loved ones. Families spend up to $500 a month to stay connected to their loved ones inside. A 15-minute phone call runs as steep as $25. Our work has never been more important. Because of COVID, prisons have shut down all in-person visitation. Low-income families have few options to communicate with loved ones.

Exclusive contracts leave prison telecommunications companies unchecked by competition: former FCC Commissioner Mignon Clyburn called the industry “the clearest, most glaring type of market failure I've ever seen as a regulator”.

Poverty and incarceration are viciously tied: over 50% of incarcerated people had no income eight years preceding their arrest. For-profit prison companies entrench this cycle. One in three families with incarcerated loved ones is forced into debt ( $13,000, on average) by the cost of maintaining contact.

This is a social and moral disaster

The Solution

A suite of free prison communications and virtual learning tools that connect the incarcerated with their loved ones, service networks, and colleges, which will improve post-release outcomes.

Connect: Video Conferencing & Virtual Learning

Reconnecting the incarcerated with their loved ones and supporting the next generation of remote prison programming. We just launched the nation's first free-to-use prison video conferencing platform.

Letters for Families

An app that bypasses the absurdly high cost of making phone calls to prison by converting texts, photos, games & news to snail mail. We currently have over 130,000 users in all 50 U.S. states, and in 42 countries.

Letters for Organization

Web app that enables criminal justice orgs, reentry groups, voting rights, and legal clinics to extend their services directly to the incarcerated using our letters infrastructure. Our users include the Marshall project, Connecticut Bail Fund, Pen America & Defy Ventures.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Partnerships & Expansion
jobs.description:
About Us
 
The Athletic is a direct-to-consumer digital sports media company committed to helping subscribers experience storytelling in a whole new way. Founded in 2016 and headquartered in San Francisco, The Athletic has over 500 full-time employees and covers more than 250 professional sports and collegiate teams in the US, Canada and the UK. The Athletic’s newsroom has produced thousands of in-depth articles along with more than 120 podcasts and premium video content. The Athletic is a remote-friendly company as we have offices in San Francisco, Los Angeles, London, and Melbourne.
 
 
About the Role
 
Our subscription business has grown rapidly over the past few years, which has been largely organic and driven by our investment in high quality content and an enthusiastic user base. More recently, we’ve expanded our strategy to include leveraging partnerships with quality brands who can increase our reach and subscriber base in our core markets of North America and the UK. With a handful of partnerships now under our belt, the opportunity is clear and we’re empowered to take bigger, more informed swings with an increasingly sophisticated approach to assessing potential deals. As we double down on this game-changing branch of growth, we need someone to lead the effort on the product side, and that’s where you come in!
 
In this role, you will work closely with the business development team to develop go-to-market strategies for deals in both North America and the UK, with potential for additional opportunities internationally. You’ll drive the product changes for these partnerships that will keep us competitive in our core markets through a balance of short-term wins with a longer-term focus. You’ll be responsible for prioritizing the infrastructure needed to enable partnerships, discussing technical implementation with the partner, and working with a cross-functional team to deliver scalable solutions, often under tight deadlines. You’ll also be tasked with streamlining the integration cycle for efficiency, including leveraging similar infrastructure where possible.



Responsibilities
  • Define our go-to-market partnerships product strategy across regions and deals, together with the leads of each business development team. 
  • Work with the business development teams to develop a menu of options to present to partners, from scrappy no-dev options to more involved integrations.
  • Collaborate with growth and core product PMs to scale infrastructure to support business development initiatives. This could include customizable landing pages and acquisition flows, curated content experiences, new payment methods, and more.
  • Integrate infrastructure investments into a quarterly roadmap that balances short-term requirements and partner deal timelines with long-term considerations of scalability. 
  • Lead quarterly prioritization process and present tradeoffs between different approaches and different business development deals across regions to stakeholders, as there will be times when the deals in the pipeline exceed our ability to execute, or the potential impact of a deal doesn’t justify the resources necessary to support. 
  • Execute on a product roadmap for business development initiatives in collaboration with Design, Engineering, Marketing, and other stakeholders.
  • Communicate strategy and results to internal stakeholders.
  • Understand the competitive environment and stay on top of great user experiences and flows, especially related to subscription signups and third-party partnerships.



Requirements
  • 2+ years of relevant product management experience at a fast-growing consumer company (subscription business is a plus).
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams, especially under tight deadlines.
  • Experience working with a diverse set of stakeholders, and ability to challenge stakeholders when needed.
  • Experience with third-party integrations is a plus.
  • Comfort with data - analyzing data, deriving insights, and making data-driven decisions.
  • Experience developing great user experiences, and an ability to empathize with users.
  • Eagerness to try new things and learn - and a willingness to fail.
The Company is backed by Founders Fund, Evolution Media, Courtside Ventures, Comcast Ventures, Bedrock Capital, Advancit Capital, Y Combinator, and other leading investors. The Athletic is headquartered in San Francisco, California. The Athletic was awarded a 2020 Great Place to Work.
 
The Athletic Media Company is an equal opportunity employer and enthusiastically encourages people from all backgrounds and experiences to apply. The Athletic will consider all applicants without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical and/or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected characteristic under applicable law.

In this role, you will lead social media and press engagement to create and maintain a positive, impactful brand identity for Impactual and several of its clients. In addition, as a member of the management team, you will support overall team coordination and contribute to the strategic growth of the firm.

About Us: Impactual LLC is a social impact consulting firm. We help causes, philanthropists and brands address some of the most pressing political and social challenges. Our clients include individual and institutional philanthropists, Fortune 500 companies, and high-impact nonprofits.

Key Responsibilities Include:

  • Brand Strategy and Implementation (35%)

You are a master organizer and planner and consistently look ahead to anticipate needs before they arise. You have a passion for or previous experience supervising and coaching staff.

Benefits
