jobs.title: Paid Social Manager
jobs.description:
Paid Social Manager

Location: Offices in Liverpool and London. This role can be remote.

Are you looking to develop your career in paid acquisition marketing? Do you understand how to maximise the acquisition potential of channels such as Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube?

We are looking for a Paid Social Manager to take responsibility for our paid social marketing, establishing the tools, systems, processes and approach that will maximise the channels potential in terms of efficient customer acquisition across all platforms.

The successful Paid Social Manager will have experience of successfully managing paid social campaigns across facebook, Instagram, and ideally youtube. The role will report into the Chief Marketing Officer.

Key Responsibilities

  • Take responsibility for managing and developing paid social activity for TLA
  • Responsible for a 6-figure monthly marketing budget
  • Design, plan and build out best in class paid social campaigns
  • Align with brand and organic social lead to ensure paid and organic campaigns are working together
  • Manage and make recommendations on the automation, tracking, and tools that are used to manage and optimise campaigns
  • Collaborate with the design team to develop and optimise campaign creative which is engaging and on brand.
  • Design, implement and manage other paid acquisition campaigns such paid search and display
  • Work closely with the commercial team to ensure that paid social is delivering on volume and efficiency targets
  • Continuous data analysis, optimisation and reporting of campaigns
  • Collaboration with other marketing channel owners to ensure learnings and best practice are shared across channels
  • Monitoring of competitor activity
  • Support other members of the marketing team

The Skills

  • Demonstrable paid social (Facebook/Instagram) advertising expertise and understanding, either agency or client-side.
  • 1+ years experience in a Paid Social role
  • Results-driven, revenue-focussed approach
  • Commercial mindset – extensive experience of working in a commercial environment.
  • Very strong analytical mind with high attention to and passion for detail
  • Collaborative and supportive working style
  • Excellent working knowledge in Google Analytics
  • Excellent working knowledge in Microsoft Excel
  • Passion for innovation and emerging technologies

Desirable

  • Experience of managing and optimising paid search and display campaigns
  • Experience of managing and optimising Youtube and snapchat paid acquisition campaigns
  • Experience and understanding of the automotive sector

About TLA

TLA is the market leader in connecting car buyers with major car brands. It uses industry-leading technology to enable automotive giants to sell more vehicles by simplifying the car buying process for consumers via useful tools, unique content, and personal recommendations across its network of owned and partner websites.

TLA works with 80% of the UK's leading Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) including BMW Group, Ford Motor Company, and Volkswagen Group, enabling £700 million of new car sales every year, more than any other specialist in the UK. Its customer acquisition platform uses cutting-edge blockchain technology to ensure seamless and secure integration with OEMs, and a personalised, and intuitive experience for the consumer, to make car buying effortless.

What's in it for you?

You will join an open and transparent business where there are no closed doors and everyone is accessible across TLA starting with Anton the CEO.

We have values that we believe in, promote and live by each day. You will join a team who work in a comfortable and productive environment where respect and teamwork are core. TLA value the importance of giving back and annually support a chosen charity, fundraising for it through sporting and social events.

You'll have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialisation. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialised skills faster. Learning and development takes place both on the job and through formal training via our professional development plans, future leaders programme, or in collaboration with others. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.

On top of this, we have an extensive benefits package which includes private health insurance, flexible working hours, pension, travel season ticket loan, cycle to work, summer and Christmas parties, free bar Fridays, monthly cake and pizza days and many more.

If this sounds like the ideal role, career and company for you, click ‘Apply To Position' below.

jobs.title: Content Marketing Writer
jobs.description:
We believe in having a transparent hiring process to provide a fair and inclusive experience to all our candidates. 

Our team is dedicated to ensuring you have a great candidate experience, and that starts with outlining our hiring process from start to finish so you know what to expect every step of the way (no surprises!)—click here to learn more!

 

Are you passionate about creating inspiring and helpful content to help readers succeed? Do you flourish when writing irresistible headlines for blogs, social media, landing pages, and emails? You’re looking for a big challenge that holds big opportunities—and you’ll find that at Thinkific!

Working as a Content Marketing Writer, you’ll craft content that both drives awareness of the Thinkific brand and acquires new customers. You may have dabbled in a bit of everything in past roles, but you now specialize in storytelling, writing long-form blogs, case studies, video scripts, and landing pages. You’ll be responsible for driving the execution of the content marketing strategy we have in place, identifying content opportunities that help Thinkific rank on organic search, drive video views, and capture the attention of customers. You don’t just craft compelling content—you have a plan for promotion, too.

In this role, you will:

  • Build case studies, blogs, ebooks, video scripts, webinars, whitepapers, emails, and similar content that can be either new or repurposed from existing material
  • Write, edit, and publish original content for both owned platforms and guest posts for external channels in order to support our demand and lead generation efforts
  • Prepare content briefs for freelance writers to complete writing assignments, coordinating project deadlines
  • Identify topic ideas and craft scripts for videos to grow our YouTube channel, working with our videographer
  • Work closely with the rest of the Content Marketing team to refine strategies, create plans, execute on, and promote content initiatives
  • Build content for varying personas and audiences, including different verticals within the SMB space and mid-market organizations
  • Wear your conversion optimization hat to test and optimize landing page copy/design and CTA impact

To be successful in this role, you likely:

  • Have 3+ years of experience in content writing, copywriting, or content marketing and are now looking to take your career to the next level
  • Are an impeccable writer and editor with a penchant for cranking out a high volume of content without sacrificing quality
  • Have experience crafting content for written materials, videos, infographics, landing pages, and web copy In addition to experience creating and executing content campaigns, online events, and other non-PPC digital campaigns
  • Are a persuasive storyteller that has successfully helped establish a company's written voice and thought leadership content (bonus points if it was for a SaaS company)
  • Know how to write irresistible headlines for blogs, social media, landing pages, and emails
  • Understand the value of a content calendar and are looking to help create content across channels and customer funnel stages for maximum reach and impact 
  • Easily relate to different user personas—you can craft compelling content that speaks to the core motivating drivers of these audiences and can jump between different personas and types of content
  • Are strategic in your content—you connect your customer focus with your marketing and growth acumen

You might be the person we’re looking for if you:

  • Are empathetic—you can put yourself in the shoes of your audience and internal stakeholders to anticipate their needs
  • Have successfully generated a large number of consistent, relevant leads from content marketing
  • Are passionate about digital marketing and business growth. We're building our own company by helping thousands of entrepreneurs around the globe build theirs—it doesn’t get more rewarding than this!
  • Plan optimization and growth experiments in your sleep. Terms like CTR, LTV, open rates, analytics, A/B testing, and acquisition funnels are also regular parts of your vocabulary
  • Constantly think outside the box, coming up with creative ways to dominate and reignite channels and connections (rapid growth is the name of the game!

Bonus points if you:

  • Previously worked at a SaaS company during a high growth stage
  • Have scaled a content program resulting in significant revenue impact
About us:

  • Make an impact with your work—each person has an equal opportunity to contribute to our goals and every day, we get to see how Thinkific is empowering both course creators and their students
  • Join one of the fastest-growing companies in Canada and find opportunities to grow in your own career—offering advancement opportunities for our team members is important to us!
  • Contribute to Thinkific’s award-winning culture—we’re one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures and a certified Great Place to Work!

  • Whether you’re at our Vancouver HQ or working from home, you’ll have the opportunity to build meaningful relationships with Thinkers on your team and across the company through team-wide events, meet and greets with new team members, and regular social events
  • Have fun with our team, even while we’re working remotely—join us for an online games session, virtual trivia and paint nights, at-home fitness challenges, or even an online coffee brewing demo! 
  • Get additional health and wellness support through a lifestyle or health spending account to put your dollars where you need it most, whether that’s subsidizing your gym membership, covering out-of-pocket expenses, or getting new gear
  • Enjoy our open vacation policy and flexible work environment, because we know the importance of having a great work-life balance (and sometimes, you do your best work in slippers)
  • Learn and Grow is one of our values and we take it seriously, providing opportunities through lunch and learns, training, workshops, mentorship, and our $1500 education allowance
  • Grow your career AND your family at Thinkific—you’ll be taken care of with our parental leave top-ups as you add to your family
  • Meet the many @dogsofthinkific (and yes, they’re as cute and cuddly as they look) 
  • Work with the hardware you’re most comfortable with, and upgrade or replace your system when you need to with our technology bonus 
  • Get set up for success, whether that’s at the office or at home. Whether you need a monitor, laptop stand, keyboard, mouse, or even a desk, we’ll work to ensure you have what you need to do your best work
  • Be confident bringing your whole self to work—we’re proud to be an inclusive company with a diverse team and values grounded in ethics and equality
  • Here at Thinkific, we know that the different perspectives on our team have led to amazing ideas, more innovation, and, ultimately, our success as a company. Our team welcomes applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, beliefs, identities, and statuses. Whoever you are—we can't wait to meet you!

Creating, Managing and Fine-Tuning Lead Generation campaigns across LinkedIn and other Sales Platforms

Analysis of Department Data to identify and solve problems in the processes

Acting as the Point-of-Contact for Review Outreach and maintaining and improving the company's exceptionally high review rating

Management and Optimization of LinkedIn, Hubspot and other Sales Platforms

Designing, planning, and execute on new client outreach campaigns, ranging from ebooks to emails

Requirements:

1+ Years Experience working with LinkedIn, Hubspot, G2, or similar CRM and review management platforms

Exceptional oral and written communications skills

Familiar with Marketing Automation tools

Comfortable working with a dynamic and fast-moving team, virtually and/or in-person


A relevant Bachelor's degree from an accredited University is preferred but not required.

Note that this is a fully virtual position with no plans to "return to office".

jobs.title: Marketing Assistant
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Marketing Manager with native German
jobs.description:
Company Description

Shpock is the platform bringing a little joy to the world of selling and buying, making it easy and safe to turn (nearly) anything into cash. With Shpock’s Secure Delivery feature millions of sellers nationwide can receive payments for items and organise shipping easily, all for free. Shpock has been downloaded more than 50 million times across Europe and is the winner of Apple’s ‘Best of App’ award in the category ‘Sustainability’ and part of Google’s “Android Excellence Apps”. All of this makes Shpock one of Europe’s most dominant shopping apps.



Job Description

Company offices are based in Vienna and London, but we are switching to a remote-first approach to working. We have been operating remotely since the pandemic started, but we do offer office space as well. Periodic visits to the office in Vienna for team events, meetups or conferences would be needed. 

Deine Aufgaben

  • Konzeption und Implementation unserer CRM Maßnahmen für mehrere Länder und Kanäle zur Steigerung des Customer Lifetime Values

  • Planen und Ausführen von Creatives und der User-Kommunikation, wie z.B. Newsletter oder Push Notifications

  • Messen, Analysieren und Optimieren aller CRM Kampagnen (z.B. durch A/B Test, Reporting)

  • Monitoring aller relevanten KPIs und Erstellen von Reports für Stakeholder

  • Identifizierung neuer Möglichkeiten um User-Segmente und Kommunikationswege weiterzuentwickeln

  • Copywriting mit präziser Ausdrucksweise und einwandfreier Grammatik

  • Selbstständiges Umsetzen von Vorgaben und das Integrieren von Feedback in die User-Kommunikation

  • Enge Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Teams (Marketplace Operations, Data, Product)



Qualifications

Deine Qualifikationen

  • Deutsch auf muttersprachlichem Niveau und exzellente Englisch Kenntnisse

  • Universitätsabschluss in Wirtschaft oder einer vergleichbaren Ausbildung mit einem Fokus auf Marketing oder CRM

  • Mindestens 2 Jahre Erfahrung im Marketing, idealerweise im CRM

  • Nachweisliche Erfahrung als Copywriter oder einer ähnlichen Rolle

  • Ausgezeichnete Kompetenzen im Verfassen, Editieren und Korrekturlesen von Texten sowohl in deutscher als auch englischer Sprache

  • Idealerweise Erfahrung mit CRM Tools

  • Performance-orientiertes Mindset, analytisches Denken und Kreativität

 

What we offer:

  • Work on a product that impacts millions of users, with the mission to enable everyone to live life to their fullest! Be proud not only to generate excellent user experiences and create great user value but to support our global environment.
  • Join at a vital time in our journey to provide a genuine impact on how we evolve. 
  • Work together with a management that supports change to improve us as a company!  
  • A transparent culture - we care for each other and always promote radical candor to improve our relationships to help create an environment for success.
  • An international working atmosphere in which we get stuff done and a learning environment with the opportunities to get the right development opportunities catered to your needs.
  • Family-friendly & work-life balance are no buzz words for us: We offer flexible working hours, remote options, family events and 10 additional vacation days for new parents (when not going on paternity leave).

Additional Information

We offer an attractive salary for this position based on your qualifications and experience. Austrian law requires us to post a minimum salary for this position, which is € 35.000,- gross per year (for a full-time job). We are willing to pay more based on the experience. We will treat your application in strict confidence!

Shpock is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. jobs.title: Senior Creator Partnerships Manager (m/f/x)
jobs.description:
About The Plate

🧑🏻‍🍳 The Plate is the first creator platform for chefs and food bloggers - we build OnlyFans for the culinary world

We reimagine how cooks share content online. Culinary content creators use The Plate to set up personal channels to which users can subscribe to. The platform’s software tools allow creators to build communities around their most loyal followers and make exclusive culinary content accessible in an engaging and monetizable way. In doing so, the Plate gives creative control back to the cooks and inspires thousands to enjoy the satisfaction that comes with creating delicious food. 

With the backing of industry-leading VC investors such as Food Labs and Village Global, The Plate is currently preparing its upcoming launch. We are a fast-growing startup located in Berlin (business) and Manila (tech) founded by two ex-strategy consultants from McKinsey and Bain. 

Curious? Visit our careers page here.

 

The role

We are looking for a Senior Creator Partnerships Manager (m/f/x) to join our team as soon as possible. You are a gastronomy expert? You know whom to turn to for the best culinary content online? We’d love to get to know you!

 

Why join

  • Passionate and ambitious team: Join our highly qualified and passionate team and help to build The Plate’s success story

  • High impact role: Take full charge of your area of expertise in an environment that values ownership but is always here to support

  • Exciting industry: Be at the forefront of the booming creator economy trend and help pioneer new ways for the culinary world

  • Backing of leading investors: Join a promising startup early on while relying on the backing The Plate has received from investors

  • Office in the heart of Berlin: Work from our office in Mitte enjoying fresh snacks, drinks and a rooftop with a view on the Fernsehturm

  • Great team experience: Become part of our curious, passionate and diverse team and join regular team events

Tasks and responsibilities

  • Build a network of culinary content creators! Become an integral part of the culinary scene and stay in the loop on everything that is happening in the industry 

  • Continuously strategize new ways to win new talents! Continuously fine-tune your strategic approach to systematically onboard the most promising culinary creators

  • Become an expert for culinary content online! Follow the most successful culinary content creators on platforms like e.g. Patreon and derive learnings and best practices

  • Support the cook’s creative process! Help creators define compelling offerings for their subscriber audiences by bringing in best practices and know-how 

  • Scale your expertise into a repeatable process! Set up systematic creator engagement and best practice sharing programs

 

Minimum Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years experience in community management, sales, key account management, talent management, hospitality or related fields

  • Deep knowledge of the culinary scene and industry dynamics

  • Natural networker with strong communication skills and a strategic mind  

  • Entrepreneurial mind-set with drive, ownership, persistence, and a hands-on attitude 

  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Suite

  • Fluency in English (oral and written)

 

Plus

  • Previous work experience and/or existing network in the culinary industry

  • Professional experience working with chefs, talents, influencers or creators

jobs.title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Company Description

Who we are…

Trustonic was formed in 2012 as a joint venture between industry heavyweights with strong pedigree in the secure chip design and digital security sectors. We are now part of the EMK Capital Portfolio.

Our technology gives our customers the confidence to manage risk. We embed security into smart devices and connected cars, for businesses to innovate and embrace new opportunities with peace of mind.

Over 2 billion devices are protected by Trustonic, and provide secure solutions for the mobile, automotive and banking & payments industries. 

We empower telecom operators to manage the lifecycle of smartphones, we secure the connected car of today, laying the foundation for future self-driving vehicles and we are the security backbone of any digital transaction from a mobile device.

Our partners include the leading device, silicon, enterprise, identity and commerce companies.

If you would like to work in a fast-moving global technology company, with great ambition, then we’d love to hear from you!



Job Description

We are on a mission to increase affordability of smartphones, improve accessibility of digital services, while securing and protecting critical data for our auto and banking and payments industry customers and partners.

We’re looking for an ambitious Senior Product Marketing Manager to join our Marketing team to lead our product marketing activity focused on the mobile industry.

Our ideal candidate will have B2B technology product marketing experience to thrive in this marketing role.

We are looking for a Product Marketing specialist. An expert in developing positioning, messaging, competitive differentiation, the candidate will enable the sales, marketing and product teams to align to create and close opportunities.  The role will also be responsible for the creation of product marketing strategy and associated materials.  Collaboration in the role will be key to success, particularly within the marketing team, product, sales and commercial delivery teams.



Qualifications

The role

  • Based (flexibly) in the UK, this position reports into our Chief Marketing Officer
  • Develop and execute a leading and competitive product marketing activity for our proposition in the mobile industry
  • Acting as the voice of the customer, with a deep understanding of customer needs and requirements.
  • Work closely with sales and product teams to develop product pricing models, key messaging, and value proposition
  • Together with the product team, educate both internal and external stakeholders on our product features and their benefits
  • Create marketing programs and materials (e.g. sales documentation, product videos, website copy, blog posts) that articulate the benefits of our products
  • Conduct market analysis to obtain understanding of the competitive landscape and help establish product differentiators
  • Create sales collateral and tools that align with the buying process and help move prospects & customers through the sales cycle
  • Assist sales on calls when appropriate to provide deeper dives into the product
  • Speak and present both internally and externally to promote the story of our product
  • Work with network of external providers to ensure the consistency of marketing materials, including creative execution and tone of voice
  • As a member of the Marketing team, contribute to the overall Marketing function, including setting the team objectives and direction

What we like to see

  • Successful track record in developing and executing a product marketing strategy in B2B technology sector
  • Strong communication and project management skills
  • Proven ability to collaborate with product and sales teams to drive
  • Experience of working in a global team, with regional experience of either Latin America or Africa, with ability to flex marketing priorities according to regional needs
  • Proven ability to create and manage marketing budgets and priorities
  • Experience of defining and using a range of marketing and project management tools, videos, digital, webinars
  • Ability to develop, organize, and maintain process documentation
  • Ability to create, update, and maintain training documents
  • Excellent grammar, punctuation and spelling skills
  • Prefer working in a collaborative, cross-team capacity. This role requires you to work across functions and departments to bring to life the product, constantly interacting with teammates, prospects, and customers.
  • Ability to effectively prioritize and manage your time to address multiple responsibilities in a fast-paced, professional environment
  • Metrics-driven and analytical; proven ability to prioritize, drive, and achieve results through self and others under time pressure
  • Ability to work with and get the best out of external agencies, including PR, freelancers, translators & use of global online creative resources

Bonus

  • Experience of working with technical teams
  • Writing and content creation experience



Additional Information

Who you are…

As a Senior Product Marketing Manager, you will be..

  • a natural self-starter who can work effectively on their own or as part of a wider team
  • a team player with strong persuasion skills able to drive consensus across multiple stakeholders
  • proven ability to create and execute a product marketing strategy and execute regionally
  • ability to learn new industry sectors quickly & identify key market insight
  • able to thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving, small team environment
  • able to balance high-level strategic thinking with hands-on tactical work to get things done quickly
  • excellent in triage with the ability to prioritize projects and work
  • entrepreneurial with an inherent sense of urgency; not afraid to take risks and get things done quickly while maintaining high standards
  • outcome focused and customer and business oriented
  • prepared to invest whatever effort is required to get the job done (including travel)
  • able to build trusted relationships with direct and extended team. Key relationships are with Sales Leadership, Product and technical team.

What makes you, you…

Experience

  • preferred experience in technology sector - mobile products (OEM, carrier, software)
  • demonstrable product marketing delivery at a global Technology company
  • experience with digital marketing tools
  • hands-on experience with different B2B product marketing examples
  • experience of working closely with sales and product teams to deliver

Languages

  • English, both written and spoken
  • Spanish is helpful

Qualifications

  • undergraduate degree in business or similar discipline preferred or equivalent level of skill, experience, and knowledge

Knowledge

  • strong understanding of mobile and / or auto industries preferred
  • understanding of marketing mix

Technical skills

  • strong marketing skills set – ability to create a concept & manage all aspects of the marketing plan to deliver
  • strong verbal and written communication skills, and ability to speak effectively to any audience
  • ability to deliver engaging presentations
  • digital experience – understanding digital tools, SEO & their impact on content creation.
 

Trustonic is an equal opportunity employer.  We do not discriminate on any grounds. We empower, engage, enable and value differences between people, including; different races, ethnicities, genders, ages, religions, disabilities and sexual orientations, with differences in education, backgrounds, skill sets, experiences and knowledge.

jobs.title: Social Media & Content Manager
jobs.description:
Sendle builds shipping that is good for the world. We help small businesses thrive by making parcel delivery simple, reliable, and affordable. We’re a B Corp and the first 100% carbon neutral delivery service in Australia & the US, where we harness major courier networks to create a delivery service that levels the playing field for small businesses. Ready to do the best work of your career with a collaborative, creative, and supportive team?

What you’ll do

The Social Media & Content Manager will use their deep understanding of social platforms and innate communications skills to build Sendle’s social media presence. You’ll engage with our Sendler community through thoughtful execution of brand and content strategies. This is an outstanding opportunity to own the brand's social presence and also play a meaningful role in building trust and authenticity with our small business owners!

Lead Social Media Strategy

  • Plan and execute social media strategies on Sendle’s existing socials: Instagram, Facebook, Linkedin, and Twitter
  • Develop social media strategies for new Sendle socials: Pinterest, YouTube, etc.
  • Own and manage our content calendar for social media, producing innovative content in collaboration with our copywriters and pr/communications team
  • Optimize our posting schedule, considering web traffic and customer engagement metrics
  • Discover opportunities for audience, traffic, and engagement growth across all social platforms
  • Analyze performance of our social content and provide insight and metrics to our team

Build Community

  • Highlight US and AU and mission aligned businesses on our social channels
  • Share feedback to the marketing team when there are common or interesting trends on social (related to a particular Sendle post, campaign, pr announcement, etc)
  • Work closely with our customer support team to improve communications where needed: monitor and respond to comments and engagement daily, clear DM messages, identify high value Sendle customers and prioritize successful resolution of their issues

Ensure Engagement

  • Drive social media engagement campaigns in partnership with our marketing team (some examples: Earth Day, Black Friday/Small Business Saturday, Giveaways, Repost Campaigns)
  • Drive social media engagement via Sendle’s always on editorial campaign calendar
  • Design and manage social media influencer and blogger campaigns
What you’ll need
  • 2+ years experience managing social media for a brand (bonus points if you have B2B experience or run your own social brand!)
  • Hands-on experience with social media software tools such as Falcon, Later, Sprout Social, Hootsuite, etc
  • Skilled writer, experienced in writing engaging social content 
  • Familiarity with differences of organic and paid social strategies
  • Organized and results-oriented with a strong dedication to accuracy and follow-through
  • Curious and creative thinker with a solutions-oriented, problem-solver mentality
  • Ability to plan, manage and execute multiple projects, while communicating with key stakeholders
  • Thrive in a fast-paced, changeable tech environment
  • Bonus points if: you have B2B experience, you’ve run your own social brand, or you’re a skilled designer with experience creating social assets 

What we’re offering

  • Remote work flexibility
  • 20 PTO Days
  • 10 Sick Days
  • 100% company paid medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • 401k and matching contributions
  • Options through participation in Sendle’s ESOP
  • Annual personal development budget, paid family leave, and more
What matters to us

We believe that our culture is one of our most important assets. We have 5 key values that we look for in every member of our team.

  • Humble - We put others first. We embrace and seek feedback from others.
  • Honest - We speak gently but frankly. We take ownership of our mistakes and speak the truth.
  • Happy - We enjoy the journey. We are optimistic and find opportunities in all things.
  • Hungry - We aspire to make a difference. We aim high, step out of our comfort zones and tackle the hard problems.
  • High-Performing - We relentlessly deliver. We know the goal and work fearlessly towards it.

Legally, we need you to know this: 

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

But it’s important to us that you know this:

We strongly believe that diversity of experience contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better outcomes. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at jobs@sendle.com to request accommodation. 

If you want to be a part of something remarkable then we’re excited to hear from you!

jobs.title: Marketing Manager, Events & Community
jobs.description:
Want to use your marketing skills to help change the world? AI is the new electricity. Millions of AI engineers will be required to transform industries with artificial intelligence, and we’re building the education platform to train them. DeepLearning.AI is providing a world-class education to people around the globe so that we can all benefit from an AI-powered future. We are an EdTech company with serious credentials, exciting marketing challenges and wonderful teammates. 
 
We are looking for an Events & Community Marketing Manager to spearhead community experiences and event marketing to keep our community engaged and connected. This would include the strategy, production, and execution of multimedia content to engage our users across events, blog and community forums, social media channels, and others. This person will define our event strategy and lead a key part in integrating our community into our broader marketing strategy.
 
We’re looking for a talented leader, a communicator, and a creative producer who is ready to create world-class events.The ideal candidate is a curious self-starter who can work collaboratively and independently to execute new ideas and projects, thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, and is passionate about developer marketing,  AI and/or education. This position reports to the Director of Marketing. Although we are headquartered in Palo Alto, we are open to remote workers as long as they are within 3 time zones of California (PDT / GMT -7).



Event Marketing
  • Develop and oversee all aspects of our event marketing program, including creating the strategy and managing end-to-end production of virtual/in-person events.
  • Monitor event performance and establish clear reporting, and updating cadences.
  • Own all production, execution, and communication operations for the event marketing channel.
  • Work closely with internal teams to build persona-target events around our core positioning. Manage a team of global event ambassadors to deliver high-quality community events.
  • Manage event marketing budget across various channels, contractors, and technology.
  • Report on key metrics of success for all event efforts and propose strategies to evolve and improve them.



Community Management
  • Manage our community, especially on Discourse, including planning, creating, sourcing, and sharing content, resources, and discussion topics to drive awareness and engagement. 
  • Innovate and develop  new ideas to connect and engage the community.
  • Design and deliver on liver and virtual community events to drive value for the community.
  • Discover and create community champions, help amplify their voices throughout the community.
  • Work closely with internal teams to evaluate larger opportunities to integrate the community into our content and event marketing plans.
  • Identify new tools and opportunities for the community to network and engage with each other regularly.
  • Regularly share insights and feedback from the community to develop actionable insights for future strategies.



Required qualifications:
  • 5+ years’ experience of scaling events & online community end-to-end, from ideation to execution
  • Proficiency in Eventbrite (or comparable registration software), Streamyard (or comparable events software), Discourse and Hubspot
  • Experience and ability to lead, motivate and coach a high performing team
  • Experience with monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on performance
  • Strong project management and collaboration skills to manage multiple tasks and projects while sticking to deadlines.



Bonus if you have:
  • Experience marketing to developer audiences
  • Experience with AI or other advanced online training and education
  • Prior startup experience wearing multiple hats within the marketing department.



What you get working with us:
  • Being part of a world-class team that’s trying to change the world
  • Working across cultural and geographical lines alongside our offices in different parts of the world.
  • Ability to learn from several marketing subject matter experts
  • A culture of life-long learning supported with a monthly stipend for professional development
  • The opportunity to be exceptionally creative with your high-impact ideas.



We hope you will fit well with our team’s culture:
  • Strong work ethic. All of us believe in our work’s ability to change human lives, and consequently, work not just smart but also hard.
  • Growth mindset. We are eager to teach you new skills and invest in your continual development. But learning is hard work, so this is something we hope you’ll want to do.
  • Team oriented. We care and watch out for each other. We’re humble individually and go after big goals together.
  • Flexibility. You should be flexible in your tasks and do whatever is needed, ranging from lower-level tasks like scheduling to high-level recruiting strategies.



What we offer:
  • DeepLearning.AI offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision coverage, a 401(k) plan, a monthly education stipend, flexible PTO, and much more. 
At DeepLearning.AI, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Bearing believes that diversity and inclusion among our employees is critical to our success as a company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. Selection for employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
